text: Then said the lord of the vineyard , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son : it may be they will reverence him when they see him .
text2: Tad vīna dārza kungs sacīja : Ko man darīt ? Es sūtīšu savu mīļo dēlu ; varbūt , redzēdami to , tie viņu ievēros .

text: But when the husbandmen saw him , they reasoned among themselves , saying , This is the heir : come , let us kill him , that the inheritance may be ours .
text2: Kad strādnieki ieraudzīja viņu , tie sevī domāja un sacīja : Šis ir mantinieks ; nogalināsim viņu , un mantojums būs mūsu !

text: So they cast him out of the vineyard , and killed him . What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them ?
text2: Un tie , izmetuši viņu no vīna dārza ārā , nonāvēja to . Ko nu gan darīs tiem vīna dārza kungs ?

text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen , and shall give the vineyard to others . And when they heard it , they said , God forbid .
text2: Viņš atnāks un iznīcinās šos dārzniekus un vīna dārzu atdos citiem . To dzirdēdami , tie sacīja Viņam : Tas nedrīkst notikt !

text: And he beheld them , and said , What is this then that is written , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner ?
text2: Bet Viņš , tos uzlūkodams , sacīja : ko tad tas nozīmē , kas rakstīts : akmens , ko atmeta namdari , kļuva par stūrakmeni ?

text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken ; but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Katrs , kas uz šo akmeni kritīs , sašķīdīs , bet uz ko tas kritīs , to sadragās . ( Ps . 117 , 22 ; Is . 28 , 16 ; Mt . 21 , 42 ; Apd . 4 , 11 ; Rom . 9 , 33 ; 1 . Pēt . 2 , 7 )

text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him ; and they feared the people : for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them .
text2: Un augstie priesteri un rakstu mācītāji , saprazdami , ka Viņš par tiem runā šo līdzību , tanī pat stundā meklēja pielikt pie Viņa rokas , bet baidījās tautas .

text: And they watched him , and sent forth spies , which should feign themselves just men , that they might take hold of his words , that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor .
text2: Un tie , novērodami Viņu , sūtīja spiegus , kas izlikās taisnīgi , lai notvertu Viņu vārdos un nodotu Viņu priekšniecībai un zemes soģa varai .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly , neither acceptest thou the person of any , but teachest the way of God truly :
text2: Un tie jautāja Viņam , sacīdami : Mācītāj , mēs zinām , ka tu pareizi runā un māci , un neskaties uz personu , bet patiesībā māci Dieva ceļu ;

text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar , or no ?
text2: Vai mums atļauts maksāt nodokļus ķeizaram , vai nē ?

text: But he perceived their craftiness , and said unto them , Why tempt ye me ?
text2: Bet Viņš , izpratis to viltību , sacīja viņiem : Kāpēc jūs mani kārdināt ?

text: Shew me a penny . Whose image and superscription hath it ? They answered and said , Caesar ' s .
text2: Parādiet man denāriju ! Kā attēls un virsraksts uz tā ? Tie atbildēja Viņam , sacīdami : Ķeizara !

text: And he said unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar ' s , and unto God the things which be God ' s .
text2: Un Viņš tiem sacīja : Tad atdodiet ķeizaram , kas ir ķeizara , un Dievam , kas ir Dieva !

text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people : and they marvelled at his answer , and held their peace .
text2: Un tie nespēja notvert Viņu vārdos tautas priekšā un , izbrīnījušies par Viņa atbildi , apklusa .

text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees , which deny that there is any resurrection ; and they asked him ,
text2: Bet tad pienāca daži no saducejiem , kas noliedz augšāmcelšanos , un jautāja Viņam ,

text: Saying , Master , Moses wrote unto us , If any man ' s brother die , having a wife , and he die without children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Sacīdami : Mācītāj , Mozus mums rakstījis : ja kam nomirst brālis , kam sieva , bet nav bērnu , tad lai viņa brālis apprecē tā sievu un rada savam brālim pēcnācējus !

text: There were therefore seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and died without children .
text2: Bija septiņi brāļi . Pirmais apprecēja sievu un , būdams bez bērniem , nomira .

text: And the second took her to wife , and he died childless .
text2: Un nākošais apprecēja viņu un nomira , būdams arī bez bērniem .

text: And the third took her ; and in like manner the seven also : and they left no children , and died .
text2: Un trešais apprecēja viņu ; tāpat visi septiņi , neatstādami bērnus , nomira .

text: Last of all the woman died also .
text2: Beigās pēc visiem nomira sieva .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she ? for seven had her to wife .
text2: Kā sieva viņa būs augšāmcelšanās brīdī , jo septiņiem viņa bijusi sieva ?

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , The children of this world marry , and are given in marriage :
text2: Un Jēzus viņiem sacīja : Šīs pasaules bērni precējas un tiek precēti .

text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world , and the resurrection from the dead , neither marry , nor are given in marriage :
text2: Bet tie , kas tiks atzīti augšāmcelšanās un tās dzīves cienīgi , ne precēsies , ne sievas ņems .

text: Neither can they die any more : for they are equal unto the angels ; and are the children of God , being the children of the resurrection .
text2: Un arī mirt viņi vairs nevarēs , jo tie līdzīgi eņģeļiem ; un viņi ir Dieva bērni , jo tie ir augšāmcelšanās bērni .

text: Now that the dead are raised , even Moses shewed at the bush , when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
text2: Bet ka miroņi celsies augšām , uz to norādīja arī Mozus pie ērkšķu krūma , kur viņš sacīja : Kungs ir Ābrahama Dievs un Īzāka Dievs , un Jēkaba Dievs .

text: For he is not a God of the dead , but of the living : for all live unto him .
text2: Bet Viņš nav mirušo , bet dzīvo Dievs , jo Viņam visi dzīvo .

text: Then certain of the scribes answering said , Master , thou hast well said .
text2: Bet daži rakstu mācītāji atbildēja Viņam , sacīdami : Mācītāj , Tu labi pateici .

text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all .
text2: Un tie neuzdrošinājās vairs neko Viņam jautāt .

text: And he said unto them , How say they that Christ is David ' s son ?
text2: Bet Viņš tiem sacīja : Kā tad saka , ka Kristus ir Dāvida Dēls ?

text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Un pats Dāvids psalmu grāmatā saka : Kungs sacīja manam Kungam : sēdies pie manas labās rokas ,

text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: Iekams es Tavus ienaidniekus lieku par pakāju Tavām kājām . ( Ps . 109 , 1 )

text: David therefore calleth him Lord , how is he then his son ?
text2: Tātad Dāvids sauc Viņu par Kungu ; un kā tad Viņš tā dēls ?

text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Bet Viņš , visai tautai dzirdot , sacīja saviem mācekļiem :

text: Beware of the scribes , which desire to walk in long robes , and love greetings in the markets , and the highest seats in the synagogues , and the chief rooms at feasts ;
text2: Sargieties no rakstu mācītājiem , kas vēlas staigāt garajos svārkos un mīl sveicienus laukumos , un pirmos sēdekļus sinagogās , un ieņemt goda vietas mielastos ,

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a shew make long prayers : the same shall receive greater damnation .
text2: Kas , izlikdamies garas lūgšanas skaitām , aprij atraitņu mājas ! Šie saņems lielāku sodu .

text: And he looked up , and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury .
text2: Tad Viņš , pacēlis savas acis , redzēja bagātos metam savus ziedojumus upuru traukā .

text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites .
text2: Bet Viņš redzēja arī kādu nabaga atraitni , divas artaviņas iemetam .

text: And he said , Of a truth I say unto you , that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all :
text2: Un Viņš sacīja : Patiesi es jums saku , ka šī nabaga atraitne ziedoja vairāk nekā visi ,

text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had .
text2: Jo šie visi ziedoja Dievam dāvanas no tā , kas tiem palika pāri , bet šī no savas trūcības upurēja visu savu iztiku , kas tai bija .

text: And as some spake of the temple , how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts , he said ,
text2: Un kad daži runāja par svētnīcu , ka tā skaistiem akmeņiem un dāvanām izgreznota , Viņš sacīja :

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Nāks dienas , kad no tā , ko jūs redzat , ne akmens uz akmens nepaliks , ko nenopostīs .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: Bet tie jautāja Viņam , sacīdami : Mācītāj , kad tas notiks , un kāda zīme tam , kad tas sāks izpildīties ?

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: Viņš sacīja : Pielūkojiet , ka jūs nepieviļ ! Jo daudzi nāks manā vārdā , sacīdami : Es tas esmu , un tas laiks ir pienācis . Bet neejiet tiem pakaļ !

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Bet kad jūs dzirdēsiet par kariem un nemieriem , nebīstieties ! Tam visam iepriekš jānotiek , bet tūdaļ vēl nav gals .

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: Tad Viņš tiem sacīja : Tauta celsies pret tautu un valsts pret valsti .

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: Un vietu vietām būs lielas zemestrīces un mēris , un bads , un šausmas , un lielas zīmes no debesīm .

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: Bet pirms visa tā viņi pacels pret jums savas rokas un vajās jūs , nododot sinagogām un cietumiem , un vedīs jūs ķēniņu un valdnieku priekšā mana vārda dēļ .

text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: Bet tas notiks jums par liecību .

text: Settle it therefore in your hearts , not to meditate before what ye shall answer :
text2: Tad nu apņematies savās sirdīs nedomāt par to , ko jūs atbildēsiet !

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: Jo es jums došu valodu un gudrību , kurai visi jūsu pretinieki nespēs pretoties un pretī runāt .

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: Pat vecāki un brāļi , un radi , un draugi jūs nodos un dažus no jums nonāvēs .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: Un visi jūs ienīdīs mana vārda dēļ ;

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: Bet neviens mats no jūsu galvas nepazudīs .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: Savā pacietībā jūs iemantosiet savas dvēseles .

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: Bet kad jūs redzēsiet karaspēku ielencam Jeruzalemi , tad ziniet , ka tās izpostīšana pienākusi .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: Tad tie , kas Jūdejā , lai bēg kalnos , kas pilsētā , lai iet ārā , un kas tās apkārtnē , lai neieiet tanī !

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Jo šīs ir atmaksas dienas , lai izpildītos viss , kas rakstīts .

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: Bet bēdas grūtniecēm un zīdītājām tanīs dienās , jo liela apspiešana nāks pār zemi un dusmas pār šo tautu .

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: Un no zobena asmens tie kritīs , un tos kā gūstekņus aizvedīs visās tautās , un pagāni mīdīs Jeruzalemi , iekams izpildīsies pagānu laiks .

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: Un būs zīmes pie saules un mēness , un zvaigznēm , un jūras kaukšanas un plūdu dēļ bailes tautām virs zemes .

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Cilvēki bailēs sastings , gaidot , kas nāks pār visu pasauli , jo debesu stiprumi sakustēsies .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: Un tad redzēs Cilvēka Dēlu nākam padebesī lielā varā un godībā .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: Bet kad tas viss sāks piepildīties , skatieties un paceliet savas galvas , jo jūsu pestīšana tuvojas !

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: Un Viņš tiem sacīja līdzību : Uzlūkojiet vīģes koku un visus kokus !

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: Kad tiem jau augļi metas , tad ziniet , ka vasara tuvu .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Tāpat arī jūs , redzot to notiekam , ziniet , ka Dieva valstība tuvu .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: Patiesi es jums saku : Šī cilts neizzudīs , iekams viss tas notiks .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Debess un zeme zudīs , bet mani vārdi nezudīs .

text: And take heed to yourselves , lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting , and drunkenness , and cares of this life , and so that day come upon you unawares .

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .

text: But ye shall not be so : but he that is greatest among you , let him be as the younger ; and he that is chief , as he that doth serve .

text: And while he yet spake , behold a multitude , and he that was called Judas , one of the twelve , went before them , and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him .

text: And as soon as it was day , the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together , and led him into their council , saying ,

text: And they said , What need we any further witness ? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth .
text2: Bet viņi sacīja : Kādas liecības mums vēl vajag ? Jo mēs paši to dzirdējām no Viņa mutes .

text: And the whole multitude of them arose , and led him unto Pilate .
text2: Un viss viņu pulks cēlās un aizveda Viņu pie Pilāta .

text: And Pilate asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answered him and said , Thou sayest it .

text2: Tad Herods ar saviem kareivjiem , viņu nonicinājis , izsmiekla dēļ apģērba Viņu baltās drēbēs un aizsūtīja atpakaļ pie Pilāta .

text: And Pilate , when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people ,

text: Said unto them , Ye have brought this man unto me , as one that perverteth the people : and , behold , I , having examined him before you , have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him :
text2: Sacīja viņiem : Jūs atvedāt pie manis šo cilvēku , it kā Viņš būtu tautas kūdītājs ; lūk , es Viņu izjautāju jūsu klātbūtnē un neatradu pie šī Cilvēka nevienas no tām vainām , kādās jūs Viņu apsūdzat ;

text: I will therefore chastise him , and release him .
text2: Tāpēc es Viņu sodīšu un atbrīvošu .

text: And they cried out all at once , saying , Away with this man , and release unto us Barabbas :

text: ( Who for a certain sedition made in the city , and for murder , was cast into prison . )

text: And they were instant with loud voices , requiring that he might be crucified . And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed .

text: And as they led him away , they laid hold upon one Simon , a Cyrenian , coming out of the country , and on him they laid the cross , that he might bear it after Jesus .
text2: Un kad Viņu veda , tie aizturēja kādu Sīmani no Kirēnes , kas nāca no laukiem , un uzlika viņam krustu , lai nes to Jēzum pakaļ .

text: And there followed him a great company of people , and of women , which also bewailed and lamented him .
text2: Bet Viņam sekoja liels pulks ļaužu un sieviešu , kas Viņu apraudāja un nožēloja .

text: But Jesus turning unto them said , Daughters of Jerusalem , weep not for me , but weep for yourselves , and for your children .
text2: Bet Jēzus , pagriezies pret tām , sacīja : Jeruzalemes meitas , neraudiet par mani , bet raudiet pašas par sevi un savu bērnu dēļ !

text: For , behold , the days are coming , in the which they shall say , Blessed are the barren , and the wombs that never bare , and the paps which never gave suck .
text2: Jo nāks dienas , kad sacīs : Svētīgas neauglīgās un tā miesas , kas nav dzemdējušas , un krūtis , kas nav barojušas .

text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains , Fall on us ; and to the hills , Cover us .
text2: Tad sāks runāt kalniem : gāzieties pār mums , un uz pakalniem : apklājiet mūs !

text: For if they do these things in a green tree , what shall be done in the dry ?
text2: Jo , ja to dara ar zaļu koku , kas notiks ar nokaltušo ?

text: And there were also two other , malefactors , led with him to be put to death .
text2: Bet līdz ar Viņu tika vestidivi citi ļaundari , lai viņus nogalinātu .

text: And when they were come to the place , which is called Calvary , there they crucified him , and the malefactors , one on the right hand , and the other on the left .
text2: Un kad tie nonāca vietā , kas saucas Kalvārija , tur tie sita Viņu un slepkavas krustā : vienu pa labi , otru pa kreisi .

text: Then said Jesus , Father , forgive them ; for they know not what they do . And they parted his raiment , and cast lots .
text2: Bet Jēzus sacīja : Tēvs , piedod viņiem , jo tie nezina , ko dara . Un tie , dalot Viņa drēbes , meta kauliņus .

text: And the people stood beholding . And the rulers also with them derided him , saying , He saved others ; let him save himself , if he be Christ , the chosen of God .
text2: Un ļaudis stāvēja un skatījās ; un priekšnieki kopā ar tiem izsmēja Viņu , sacīdami : Citiem Viņš palīdzēja , - lai glābj sevi , ja Viņš ir Kristus , Dieva izredzētais .

text: And the soldiers also mocked him , coming to him , and offering him vinegar ,
text2: Arī kareivji , Viņu izsmiedami , nāca un sniedza Viņam etiķi ,

text: And saying , If thou be the king of the Jews , save thyself .
text2: Un sacīja : Ja Tu esi jūdu ķēniņš , tad glāb sevi !

text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek , and Latin , and Hebrew , THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Un bija arī virs Viņa uzraksts , rakstīts grieķu un latīņu , un ebreju valodā : Šis ir jūdu Ķēniņš .

text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him , saying , If thou be Christ , save thyself and us .
text2: Bet viens no tiem ļaundariem , kas bija piesists krustā , zaimoja Viņu , sacīdams : Ja Tu esi Kristus , tad glāb sevi un mūs !

text: But the other answering rebuked him , saying , Dost not thou fear God , seeing thou art in the same condemnation ?
text2: Bet otrs atbildēdams norāja viņu un sacīja : Pats tu , būdams tanī pat sodā , nebīsties Dieva !

text: And we indeed justly ; for we receive the due reward of our deeds : but this man hath done nothing amiss .
text2: Jo mēs taču saņemam taisnīgi un pienācīgi par mūsu darbiem , bet Viņš nekā ļauna nav darījis .

text: And he said unto Jesus , Lord , remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom .
text2: Un viņš sacīja Jēzum : Kungs , piemini mani , kad Tu nāksi savā valstībā !

text: And Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , To day shalt thou be with me in paradise .
text2: Un Jēzus sacīja viņam : Patiesi , es tev saku : šodien tu būsi ar mani paradīzē .

text: And it was about the sixth hour , and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour .
text2: Bet bija ap sesto stundu , un tumsa iestājās līdz pat devītajai stundai .

text: And the sun was darkened , and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst .
text2: Un saule aptumšojās , un priekškars svētnīcā pārplīsa vidū pušu .

text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice , he said , Father , into thy hands I commend my spirit : and having said thus , he gave up the ghost .
text2: Un Jēzus sauca skaļā balsī , sacīdams : Tēvs , Tavās rokās es nododu savu garu ! Un Viņš , to teikdams , izdvesa garu .

text: Now when the centurion saw what was done , he glorified God , saying , Certainly this was a righteous man .
text2: Bet simtnieks , redzēdams to , kas notika , godināja Dievu , sacīdams : Patiesi , šis Cilvēks bija taisnīgs !

text: And all the people that came together to that sight , beholding the things which were done , smote their breasts , and returned .
text2: Un viss ļaužu pulks , kas bija klāt pie šī šausmu skata , redzot notikušo , sita savās krūtīs un atgriezās atpakaļ .

text: And all his acquaintance , and the women that followed him from Galilee , stood afar off , beholding these things .
text2: Bet visi Viņa pazīstamie un sievietes , kas ar Viņu bija nākušas no Galilejas , to redzēdamas , stāvēja nostāk .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Joseph , a counseller ; and he was a good man , and a just :
text2: Un , lūk , viens vīrs , Jāzeps vārdā , būdams labs un taisnīgs cilvēks , kas bija pilsētas pārvaldes loceklis ,

text: ( The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them ; ) he was of Arimathaea , a city of the Jews : who also himself waited for the kingdom of God .
text2: No Arimatejas , Jūdejas pilsētas , kas arī pats gaidīja Dieva valstību , nepiekrita to lēmumiem un darbiem ;

text: This man went unto Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus .
text2: Šis aizgāja pie Pilāta un lūdza Jēzus miesas .

text: And he took it down , and wrapped it in linen , and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone , wherein never man before was laid .
text2: Un viņš tās noņēma un ietina audeklā , un ielika izcirstā kapā , kur vēl neviens nebija glabāts .

text: And that day was the preparation , and the sabbath drew on .
text2: Un tā bija sagatavošanās diena , un sabats jau tuvojās .

text: And the women also , which came with him from Galilee , followed after , and beheld the sepulchre , and how his body was laid .
text2: Bet sekotājas sievietes , kas ar Viņu bija nākušas no Galilejas , redzēja kapu un to , kā Viņa miesas tika noliktas .

text: And they returned , and prepared spices and ointments ; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment .
text2: Un atgriezušās , viņas sagatavoja smaržas un svaidāmās zāles , bet sabatu saskaņā ar bauslību tās pavadīja klusu .

text: Now upon the first day of the week , very early in the morning , they came unto the sepulchre , bringing the spices which they had prepared , and certain others with them .
text2: Bet pirmajā nedēļas dienā ļoti agri viņas atnāca pie kapa , nesdamas smaržas , ko tās bija sagatavojušas .

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre .
text2: Un tās atrada akmeni no kapa noveltu ,

text: And they entered in , and found not the body of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Un viņas gāja iekšā , bet Kunga Jēzus miesas neatrada .

text: And it came to pass , as they were much perplexed thereabout , behold , two men stood by them in shining garments :
text2: Un notika , kamēr viņas bija savā prātā satriektas par to , lūk , divi vīri spožās drānās piebiedrojās viņām .

text: And as they were afraid , and bowed down their faces to the earth , they said unto them , Why seek ye the living among the dead ?
text2: Un kad tās pārbijušās vērsa savu seju pret zemi , viņi tām sacīja : Ko jūs meklējat dzīvo starp mirušajiem ?

text: He is not here , but is risen : remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee ,
text2: Viņa šeit nav , bet Viņš ir augšāmcēlies . Atminieties , ko Viņš jums teica , kamēr vēl bija Galilejā ,

text: Saying , The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men , and be crucified , and the third day rise again .
text2: Sacīdams : Cilvēka Dēlam jābūt nodotam cilvēku - grēcinieku rokās , jātop krustā sistam un trešajā dienā jāceļas no miroņiem .

text: And they remembered his words ,
text2: Un tās atminējās Viņa vārdus .

text: And returned from the sepulchre , and told all these things unto the eleven , and to all the rest .
text2: Un viņas , atgriezušās no kapa , paziņoja to visu tiem vienpadsmit un visiem pārējiem .

text: It was Mary Magdalene , and Joanna , and Mary the mother of James , and other women that were with them , which told these things unto the apostles .
text2: Bet tur bija Marija Magdalēna un Joanna , un Marija , Jēkaba māte , un citas , kas ar tām bija un kas apustuļiem to sacīja .

text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales , and they believed them not .
text2: Un šie vārdi tiem izlikās neprātīgi ; un tie viņām neticēja .

text: Then arose Peter , and ran unto the sepulchre ; and stooping down , he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves , and departed , wondering in himself at that which was come to pass .
text2: Bet Pēteris piecēlies aizskrēja pie kapa un , pieliecies uz priekšu , ieraudzīja vienīgi noliktos autus un aizgāja , brīnīdamies sevī par notikušo .

text: And , behold , two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus , which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs .
text2: Un , lūk , divi no viņiem tanī pat dienā gāja uz miestu , vārdā Emmaus , kas atradās sešdesmit stadiju attālumā no Jeruzalemes .

text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened .
text2: Un viņi savā starpā sarunājās par visu to , kas bija noticis .

text: And it came to pass , that , while they communed together and reasoned , Jesus himself drew near , and went with them .
text2: Un notika , ka , viņiem sarunājoties un vienam otru izvaicājot , arī pats Jēzus tuvojās un gāja kopā ar viņiem .

text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him .
text2: Bet viņu acis tika turētas , lai tie Viņu nepazītu .

text: And he said unto them , What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another , as ye walk , and are sad ?
text2: Un Viņš tiem sacīja : Kas tās par runām , ko jūs , iedami , savā starpā runājat un esat noskumuši ?

text: And the one of them , whose name was Cleopas , answering said unto him , Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem , and hast not known the things which are come to pass therein these days ?
text2: Tad viens , kam vārds Kleofass , atbildēja Viņam , sacīdams : Vai Tu viens pats esi tāds svešinieks Jeruzalemē , kas nezina , kas tur šinīs dienās noticis ?

text: And he said unto them , What things ? And they said unto him , Concerning Jesus of Nazareth , which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people :
text2: Un Viņš tiem sacīja : Kas tad ? Un viņi teica : Par Jēzu no Nācaretes , kas bija pravietis , varens darbos un vārdos Dieva un visas tautas priekšā ,

text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death , and have crucified him .
text2: Un ka augstie priesteri un mūsu priekšnieki nodeva Viņu pazudināšanai nāvē un piesita Viņu krustā .

text: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel : and beside all this , to day is the third day since these things were done .
text2: Bet mēs cerējām , ka Viņš atpestīs Izraēli ; un šodien ir trešā diena pēc visa tā , kas notika .

text: Yea , and certain women also of our company made us astonished , which were early at the sepulchre ;
text2: Bet arī dažas no mūsu sievietēm , kas pirms gaismas bijušas pie kapa , izbiedēja mūs .

text: And when they found not his body , they came , saying , that they had also seen a vision of angels , which said that he was alive .
text2: Un tās , neatradušas Viņa miesu , nāca un sacīja : Šīs arī eņģeļu parādīšanos redzējušas . Kas saka , ka Viņš dzīvo .

text: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre , and found it even so as the women had said : but him they saw not .
text2: Un daži no mūsējiem aizgāja pie kapa un viss bija tā , kā sievietes bija sacījušas , bet Viņu neatrada .

text: Then he said unto them , O fools , and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken :
text2: Tad Viņš tiem sacīja : Jūs , neprašas un sirdskūtrie , lai ticētu visam tam , ko pravieši runājuši !

text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things , and to enter into his glory ?
text2: Vai Kristum tā nebija jācieš un jāieiet savā godībā ?

text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets , he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself .
text2: Un , iesākdams no Mozus un visiem praviešiem , Viņš tiem izskaidroja visus Rakstus , kas par Viņu bija uzrakstīti .

text: And they drew nigh unto the village , whither they went : and he made as though he would have gone further .
text2: Un viņi tuvojās miestam , kurp tie gāja , bet Viņš izlikās tālāk ejot .

text: But they constrained him , saying , Abide with us : for it is toward evening , and the day is far spent . And he went in to tarry with them .
text2: Bet tie Viņu ļoti lūdza , sacīdami : Paliec ar mums , jo vakars jau metas un diena tuvojas beigām ! Un Viņš iegāja pie tiem .

text: And it came to pass , as he sat at meat with them , he took bread , and blessed it , and brake , and gave to them .
text2: Un notika , ka Viņš , būdams ar tiem pie galda , paņēma maizi un svētīja , un lauza , un pasniedza to viņiem .

text: And their eyes were opened , and they knew him ; and he vanished out of their sight .
text2: Tad viņu acis atvērās ; un tie pazina Viņu , bet Viņš nozuda no to acīm .

text: And they said one to another , Did not our heart burn within us , while he talked with us by the way , and while he opened to us the scriptures ?
text2: Un viņi teica viens otram : Vai mūsu sirds nedega mūsos , kad Viņš ceļā runāja mums , atklādams mums Rakstus ?

text: And they rose up the same hour , and returned to Jerusalem , and found the eleven gathered together , and them that were with them ,
text2: Un tai pašā stundā viņi cēlās , atgriezās Jeruzalemē un atrada sanākušus tos vienpadsmit un arī tos , kas ar viņiem bija ;

text: Saying , The Lord is risen indeed , and hath appeared to Simon .
text2: Tie sacīja : Kungs patiesi augšāmcēlies un parādījās Sīmanim .

text: And they told what things were done in the way , and how he was known of them in breaking of bread .
text2: Un viņi stāstīja , kas notika ceļā , un kā tie , kad Viņš lauza maizi , to pazina .

text: And as they thus spake , Jesus himself stood in the midst of them , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: Bet kamēr viņi tā runāja , Jēzus nostājās viņu vidū un sacīja tiem : Miers jums , nebīstieties , es tas esmu !

text: But they were terrified and affrighted , and supposed that they had seen a spirit .
text2: Bet viņi iztrūkās un izbijušies domāja garu redzam .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye troubled ? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts ?
text2: Un Viņš sacīja tiem : Kāpēc esat tā izbijušies un kāpēc tādas domas rodas jūsu sirdīs ?

text: Behold my hands and my feet , that it is I myself : handle me , and see ; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones , as ye see me have .
text2: Skatiet manas rokas un kājas , jo es pats tas esmu ! Taustiet un redziet , jo garam miesas un kaulu nav , kā to redzat man !

text: And when he had thus spoken , he shewed them his hands and his feet .
text2: Un Viņš , to sacījis , tiem parādīja rokas un kājas .

text: And while they yet believed not for joy , and wondered , he said unto them , Have ye here any meat ?
text2: Bet kad viņi priekā vēl neticēja un brīnījās , Viņš tiem sacīja : Vai jums ir šeit kas ēdams ?

text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish , and of an honeycomb .
text2: Un tie Viņam atnesa gabalu ceptas zivs un kāri medus .

text: And he took it , and did eat before them .
text2: Un kad Viņš to klātbūtnē bija ēdis , paņēmis atlikušo , viņš deva tiem .

text: And he said unto them , These are the words which I spake unto you , while I was yet with you , that all things must be fulfilled , which were written in the law of Moses , and in the prophets , and in the psalms , concerning me .
text2: Un Viņš tiem sacīja : Šie ir vārdi , ko es jums sacīju , vēl pie jums būdams , ka nepieciešami visam bija jāpiepildās , kas par mani rakstīts Mozus bauslībā un praviešos , un psalmos .

text: Then opened he their understanding , that they might understand the scriptures ,
text2: Tad Viņš tiem atvēra prātu , lai izprastu Rakstus .

text: And said unto them , Thus it is written , and thus it behoved Christ to suffer , and to rise from the dead the third day :
text2: Un Viņš tiem sacīja : Jo tā rakstīts un tā Kristum vajadzēja ciest un trešajā dienā no miroņiem augšāmcelties .

text: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations , beginning at Jerusalem .
text2: Un Viņa vārdā jāsludina grēku gandarīšana un grēku piedošana visām tautām , sākot ar Jeruzalemi .

text: And ye are witnesses of these things .
text2: Bet jūs esat liecinieki par šo visu .

text: And , behold , I send the promise of my Father upon you : but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem , until ye be endued with power from on high .
text2: Un es jums sūtu sava Tēva apsolīto , bet jūs palieciet pilsētā , kamēr tiksiet tērpti spēkā no augšienes !

text: And he led them out as far as to Bethany , and he lifted up his hands , and blessed them .
text2: Un Viņš tos izveda ārā līdz Betānijai , un savas rokas pacēlis , svētīja tos .

text: And it came to pass , while he blessed them , he was parted from them , and carried up into heaven .
text2: Un notika , ka Viņš , svētījot tos , attālinājās no tiem un pacēlās debesīs .

text: And they worshipped him , and returned to Jerusalem with great joy :
text2: Bet tie pielūguši Viņu , lielā priekā atgriezās Jeruzalemē .

text: And were continually in the temple , praising and blessing God . Amen .
text2: Un viņi vienmēr bija svētnīcā , godinādami un teikdami Dievu . Amen .

text: In the beginning was the Word , and the Word was with God , and the Word was God .
text2: Iesākumā bija Vārds , un Vārds bija pie Dieva , un Dievs bija Vārds .

text: The same was in the beginning with God .
text2: Tas iesākumā bija pie Dieva .

text: All things were made by him ; and without him was not any thing made that was made .
text2: No Viņa viss radies , un bez Viņa nekas nav radies , kas radīts .

text: In him was life ; and the life was the light of men .
text2: Viņā bija dzīvība , un dzīvība bija cilvēku gaisma .

text: And the light shineth in darkness ; and the darkness comprehended it not .
text2: Un gaisma spīd tumsībā , bet tumsība to neuzņēma .

text: There was a man sent from God , whose name was John .
text2: Bija cilvēks , Dieva sūtīts , vārdā Jānis .

text: The same came for a witness , to bear witness of the Light , that all men through him might believe .
text2: Viņš nāca liecības dēļ , lai liecinātu par gaismu , lai visi ticētu caur viņu .

text: He was not that Light , but was sent to bear witness of that Light .
text2: Viņš nebija gaisma , bet lai liecinātu par gaismu .

text: That was the true Light , which lighteth every man that cometh into the world .
text2: Bija patiesa Gaisma , kas apgaismo katru cilvēku , kas nāk šinī pasaulē .

text: He was in the world , and the world was made by him , and the world knew him not .
text2: Viņš bija pasaulē , un pasaule ir Viņa radīta , un pasaule Viņu neatzina .

text: He came unto his own , and his own received him not .
text2: Viņš nāca savā īpašumā , bet savējie Viņu neuzņēma .

text: But as many as received him , to them gave he power to become the sons of God , even to them that believe on his name :
text2: Bet kuri Viņu uzņēma , kas tic Viņa vārdam , tiem Viņš deva varu kļūt par Dieva bērniem .

text: Which were born , not of blood , nor of the will of the flesh , nor of the will of man , but of God .
text2: Kas ne no asinīm , ne no miesas iegribas , ne no vīra gribas , bet no Dieva dzimuši .

text: And the Word was made flesh , and dwelt among us , ( and we beheld his glory , the glory as of the only begotten of the Father , ) full of grace and truth .
text2: Un Vārds kļuva miesa un dzīvoja starp mums ; un mēs redzējām Viņa godību , Tēva Vienpiedzimušā godību , pilnu žēlastības un patiesības .

text: John bare witness of him , and cried , saying , This was he of whom I spake , He that cometh after me is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Jānis liecina par Viņu un sauc , sacīdams : Šis bija Tas , par ko es sacīju : kas pēc manis nāks , Tas bija pirms manis , jo Viņš bija agrāk nekā es ,

text: And of his fulness have all we received , and grace for grace .
text2: Jo no Viņa pilnības mēs visi esam saņēmuši žēlastību pēc žēlastības .

text: For the law was given by Moses , but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ .
text2: Jo Mozus deva bauslību , bet žēlastība un patiesība notika caur Jēzu Kristu .

text: No man hath seen God at any time ; the only begotten Son , which is in the bosom of the Father , he hath declared him .
text2: Dievu neviens nekad nav redzējis : vienpiedzimušais Dēls , kas ir Tēva klēpī , To atklāja .

text: And this is the record of John , when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him , Who art thou ?
text2: Un šī ir Jāņa liecība , kad jūdi no Jeruzalemes sūtīja pie tā priesterus un levītus , lai jautātu Viņam : Kas tu esi ?

text: And he confessed , and denied not ; but confessed , I am not the Christ .
text2: Un viņš atzinās un neliedzās ; un viņš apliecināja : Es neesmu Kristus .

text: And they asked him , What then ? Art thou Elias ? And he saith , I am not . Art thou that prophet ? And he answered , No .
text2: Un tie jautāja Viņam : Kas tad ? Vai tu esi Elijs ? Un viņš sacīja : Es neesmu . Vai tu esi pravietis ? Un viņš atbildēja : Nē !

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? that we may give an answer to them that sent us . What sayest thou of thyself ?
text2: Tad tie viņam sacīja : Kas tad tu esi ? Mums taču jādod atbilde tiem , kas mūs sūtīja . Ko tu pats par sevi saki ?

text: He said , I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness , Make straight the way of the Lord , as said the prophet Esaias .
text2: Viņš sacīja : Es esmu saucēja balss tuksnesī . Sataisiet Kunga ceļu , kā to teicis pravietis Isajs ! ( Is . 40 , 3 )

text: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees .
text2: Un atsūtītie bija farizeji .

text: And they asked him , and said unto him , Why baptizest thou then , if thou be not that Christ , nor Elias , neither that prophet ?
text2: Un tie viņam jautāja : Kāpēc tad tu kristī , ja tu neesi ne Kristus , ne Elijs , ne pravietis ?

text: John answered them , saying , I baptize with water : but there standeth one among you , whom ye know not ;
text2: Jānis atbildēja viņiem , sacīdams : Es kristīju ar ūdeni , bet starp jums atrodas Viens , ko jūs nepazīstat .

text: He it is , who coming after me is preferred before me , whose shoe ' s latchet I am not worthy to unloose .
text2: Šis ir Tas , kas nāks pēc manis , kam es neesmu cienīgs atraisīt kurpju siksnas .

text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan , where John was baptizing .
text2: Tas notika Betānijā , viņpus Jordānas , kur Jānis kristīja .

text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him , and saith , Behold the Lamb of God , which taketh away the sin of the world .
text2: Otrā dienā Jānis redzēja Jēzu nākam pie viņa un sacīja : Lūk , Dieva Jērs , kas deldē pasaules grēkus .

text: This is he of whom I said , After me cometh a man which is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Šis ir , par ko es teicu : Pēc manis nāks Vīrs , kas bija pirms manis , jo Viņš bija pirmāk nekā es .

text: And I knew him not : but that he should be made manifest to Israel , therefore am I come baptizing with water .
text2: Un es Viņu nepazinu , bet es nācu tāpēc , kristīdams ar ūdeni , lai Viņš kļūtu zināms Izraēlim .

text: And John bare record , saying , I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove , and it abode upon him .
text2: Un Jānis liecināja , sacīdams : Es redzēju Garu kā balodi nolaižamies no debesīm un paliekam uz Viņa .

text: And I knew him not : but he that sent me to baptize with water , the same said unto me , Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending , and remaining on him , the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Un es Viņu nepazinu , bet , kas mani sūtīja kristīt ar ūdeni , tas man sacīja : Uz kā tu redzēsi Garu nonākam un uz Viņa paliekam , tas ir , kas krista Svētajā Garā .

text: And I saw , and bare record that this is the Son of God .
text2: Un es redzēju un liecināju , ka Viņš ir Dieva Dēls .

text: Again the next day after John stood , and two of his disciples ;
text2: Otrā dienā Jānis un divi no viņa mācekļiem atkal stāvēja .

text: And looking upon Jesus as he walked , he saith , Behold the Lamb of God !
text2: Un viņš , ieraudzījis Jēzu staigājam , sacīja : Lūk , Dieva Jērs !

text: And the two disciples heard him speak , and they followed Jesus .
text2: Un abi mācekļi dzirdēja viņu sakām un sekoja Jēzum .

text: Then Jesus turned , and saw them following , and saith unto them , What seek ye ? They said unto him , Rabbi , ( which is to say , being interpreted , Master , ) where dwellest thou ?
text2: Bet Jēzus , pagriezies un redzēdams viņus sekojam , sacīja tiem : Ko jūs meklējat ? Tie Viņam atbildēja : Rabbi ( kas tulkojumā nozīmē : Mācītāj ) , kur Tu mājo ?

text: He saith unto them , Come and see . They came and saw where he dwelt , and abode with him that day : for it was about the tenth hour .
text2: Viņš tiem sacīja : Nāciet un skatieties ! Tad tie gāja un redzēja , kur Viņš mājo , un palika tanī dienā pie Viņa . Bija apmēram desmitā stunda .

text: One of the two which heard John speak , and followed him , was Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother .
text2: Bet Andrejs , Sīmaņa Pētera brālis , bija viens no tiem diviem , kas to no Jāņa bija dzirdējuši un Viņam sekojuši .

text: He first findeth his own brother Simon , and saith unto him , We have found the Messias , which is , being interpreted , the Christ .
text2: Viņš vispirms atrada savu brāli Sīmani un sacīja Viņam : Mēs atradām Mesiju ( kas tulkojumā - Kristus ) ,

text: And he brought him to Jesus . And when Jesus beheld him , he said , Thou art Simon the son of Jona : thou shalt be called Cephas , which is by interpretation , A stone .
text2: Un atveda to pie Jēzus . Bet Jēzus , uzlūkojis viņu , sacīja : Tu esi Sīmanis , Jonas dēls ; tu sauksies Kēfa , kas tulkojumā - Pēteris .

text: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee , and findeth Philip , and saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Nākošajā dienā Viņš gribēja iet uz Galileju . Bet Jēzus atrada Filipu un sacīja viņam : Seko man !

text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida , the city of Andrew and Peter .
text2: Bet Filips bija no Betsaidas , Andreja un Pētera pilsētas .

text: Philip findeth Nathanael , and saith unto him , We have found him , of whom Moses in the law , and the prophets , did write , Jesus of Nazareth , the son of Joseph .
text2: Bet Filips sastapa Natanaēli un sacīja viņam : Mēs atradām Jēzu , Jāzepa dēlu no Nācaretes . Par Viņu Mozus rakstījis savā bauslībā un pravieši .

text: And Nathanael said unto him , Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth ? Philip saith unto him , Come and see .
text2: Un Natanaēls viņam sacīja : Vai no Nācaretes var būt kas labs ? Filips viņam saka : Nāc un skaties !

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him , and saith of him , Behold an Israelite indeed , in whom is no guile !
text2: Jēzus , redzēdams Natanaēlu nākam pie sevis , sacīja par viņu : Lūk , kur patiess izraēlietis , kurā nav viltības !

text: Nathanael saith unto him , Whence knowest thou me ? Jesus answered and said unto him , Before that Philip called thee , when thou wast under the fig tree , I saw thee .
text2: Natanaēls sacīja Viņam : No kurienes Tu mani pazīsti ? Jēzus atbildēja viņam , sacīdams : Pirms Fillips tevi aicināja , tu biji zem vīģes koka .

text: Nathanael answered and saith unto him , Rabbi , thou art the Son of God ; thou art the King of Israel .
text2: Natanaēls Viņam atbildēja un sacīja : Rabbi , Tu esi Dieva Dēls . Tu esi Izraēļa Ķēniņš .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Because I said unto thee , I saw thee under the fig tree , believest thou ? thou shalt see greater things than these .
text2: Jēzus atbildēja viņam , sacīdams : Tu tici tāpēc , ka es tev sacīju : es redzēju tevi zem vīģes koka . Tu redzēsi lielākas lietas par šīm .

text: And he saith unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Hereafter ye shall see heaven open , and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man .
text2: Un Viņš tam sacīja : Patiesi , patiesi , es jums saku : jūs redzēsiet debesis atvērtas un Dieva eņģeļus uzejam un nonākam pār Cilvēka Dēlu .

text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee ; and the mother of Jesus was there :
text2: Un trešajā dienā Galilejas Kānā bija kāzas ; un Jēzus māte bija tur .

text: And both Jesus was called , and his disciples , to the marriage .
text2: Bet arī Jēzus un Viņa mācekļi tika aicināti kāzās .

text: And when they wanted wine , the mother of Jesus saith unto him , They have no wine .
text2: Un , kad pietrūka vīna , Jēzus māte sacīja Viņam : Viņiem nav vīna .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , what have I to do with thee ? mine hour is not yet come .
text2: Bet Jēzus viņai sacīja : Kas man un tev , sieviet ? Vēl mana stunda nav nākusi !

text: His mother saith unto the servants , Whatsoever he saith unto you , do it .
text2: Viņa māte sacīja apkalpotājiem : Visu , ko Viņš jums sacīs , dariet .

text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone , after the manner of the purifying of the Jews , containing two or three firkins apiece .
text2: Bet saskaņā ar jūdu šķīstīšanos tur bija novietoti seši akmens trauki ūdenim , un katrā no tiem ietilpa divi vai trīs mēri .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Fill the waterpots with water . And they filled them up to the brim .
text2: Jēzus sacīja viņiem : Piepildiet traukus ar ūdeni ! Un viņi tos piepildīja līdz malām .

text: And he saith unto them , Draw out now , and bear unto the governor of the feast . And they bare it .
text2: Tad Jēzus sacīja viņiem : Tagad smeliet un nesiet galdzinim ! Un viņi aiznesa .

text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine , and knew not whence it was : ( but the servants which drew the water knew ; ) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom ,
text2: Bet , kad galdzinis nogaršoja ūdeni , tas bija pārvērsts vīnā . Nezinādams , no kurienes tas ( kamēr apkalpotāji , kas smēla ūdeni , to zināja ) , galdzinis aicināja līgavaini .

text: And saith unto him , Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine ; and when men have well drunk , then that which is worse : but thou hast kept the good wine until now .
text2: Un sacīja viņam : Ikviens cilvēks vispirms pasniedz labo vīnu , bet , kad tie jau ieskurbuši , tad sliktāko ; bet tu taupīji labo vīnu līdz šim .

text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee , and manifested forth his glory ; and his disciples believed on him .
text2: Šo sākumu brīnumiem Jēzus darīja Galilejas Kānā , atklādams savu godību ; un Viņa mācekļi ticēja uz Viņu .

text: After this he went down to Capernaum , he , and his mother , and his brethren , and his disciples : and they continued there not many days .
text2: Pēc tam Viņš un Viņa māte , un Viņa brāļi , un Viņa mācekļi aizgāja uz Kafarnaumu un tur palika dažas dienas .

text: And the Jews ' passover was at hand , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem ,
text2: Un jūdu Lieldienas bija tuvu ; un Jēzus aizgāja uz Jeruzalemi .

text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves , and the changers of money sitting :
text2: Un Viņš atrada svētnīcā sēžam vēršu un avju , un baložu pārdevējus , un naudas mijējus .

text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords , he drove them all out of the temple , and the sheep , and the oxen ; and poured out the changers ' money , and overthrew the tables ;
text2: Un Viņš , iztaisījis no auklām pātagu , izdzina visus no svētnīcas , arī avis un vēršus , bet mijēju naudu izkaisīja un apgāza galdus .

text: And said unto them that sold doves , Take these things hence ; make not my Father ' s house an house of merchandise .
text2: Bet tiem , kas pārdeva baložus , Viņš sacīja : Aiznesiet tos no šejienes un nepadariet mana Tēva namu par tirgus māju !

text: And his disciples remembered that it was written , The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up .
text2: Tad Viņa mācekļi atminējās , ka ir rakstīts : Centība par Tavu namu mani iznīcina ( Ps 68 ) .

text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him , What sign shewest thou unto us , seeing that thou doest these things ?
text2: Bet jūdi atsaucās un sacīja Viņam : Kādu zīmi Tu mums rādi , tā darīdams .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Destroy this temple , and in three days I will raise it up .
text2: Jēzus atbildēja viņiem : Nojauciet šo svētnīcu , un es trijās dienās to uzcelšu .

text: Then said the Jews , Forty and six years was this temple in building , and wilt thou rear it up in three days ?
text2: Tad jūdi sacīja : Četrdesmit sešus gadus šī svētnīca celta , un Tu to uzcelsi trijās dienās ?

text: But he spake of the temple of his body .
text2: Bet Viņš runāja par savu miesas svētnīcu .

text: When therefore he was risen from the dead , his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them ; and they believed the scripture , and the word which Jesus had said .
text2: Kad nu Viņš bija uzcēlies , Viņa mācekļi atminējās , ka Viņš to sacījis , un ticēja Rakstiem un vārdiem , ko Jēzus bija runājis .

text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover , in the feast day , many believed in his name , when they saw the miracles which he did .
text2: Bet , kad nu Viņš Lieldienas svētku dienā bija Jeruzalemē , tad daudzi , redzēdami brīnumus , ko Viņš darīja , ticēja Viņa vārdam .

text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them , because he knew all men ,
text2: Bet pats Jēzus viņiem neuzticējās , jo Viņš visus pazina .

text: And needed not that any should testify of man : for he knew what was in man .
text2: Un Viņam nebija vajadzības , lai kāds liecinātu par cilvēku , jo pats zināja , kas ir cilvēkā .

text: There was a man of the Pharisees , named Nicodemus , a ruler of the Jews :
text2: Bet bija cilvēks no farizejiem , vārdā Nikodēms , jūdu priekšnieks .

text: The same came to Jesus by night , and said unto him , Rabbi , we know that thou art a teacher come from God : for no man can do these miracles that thou doest , except God be with him .
text2: Tas naktī atnāca pie Jēzus un sacīja Viņam : Rabbi ! Mēs zinām , ka Tu esi no Dieva nācis mācītājs , jo neviens nevar tādus brīnumus darīt , kādus Tu dari , ja ar Viņu nav Dievs .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of God .
text2: Jēzus atbildēja viņam , sacīdams : Patiesi , patiesi es tev saku : Ja kas no jauna neatdzimst , tas Dieva valstību nevar saskatīt .

text: Nicodemus saith unto him , How can a man be born when he is old ? can he enter the second time into his mother ' s womb , and be born ?
text2: Nikodēms sacīja Viņam : Kā var cilvēks , būdams vecs , piedzimt ? Vai viņš var vēlreiz atgriezties mātes miesās un no jauna piedzimt ?

text: Jesus answered , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Jēzus atbildēja : Patiesi , patiesi es tev saku : ja kas neatdzimst no ūdens un Svētā Gara , tas nevar ieiet debesu valstībā .

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh ; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit .
text2: Kas no miesas ir dzimis , tas ir miesa , bet , kas no Gara ir dzimis , ir gars .

text: Marvel not that I said unto thee , Ye must be born again .
text2: Nebrīnies par to , ka es tev sacīju : jums vajag no jauna atdzimt .

text: The wind bloweth where it listeth , and thou hearest the sound thereof , but canst not tell whence it cometh , and whither it goeth : so is every one that is born of the Spirit .
text2: Gars dveš , kur gribēdams , un tu dzirdi tā balsi , bet nezini , no kurienes tas nāk un kurp aiziet . Tā ir ar katru , kas piedzimis no Gara .

text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him , How can these things be ?
text2: Nikodēms atbildēja Viņam , sacīdams : Kā tas var notikt ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Art thou a master of Israel , and knowest not these things ?
text2: Jēzus atbildēja viņam un sacīja : Tu esi Izraēļa mācītājs , un tu to nezini ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , We speak that we do know , and testify that we have seen ; and ye receive not our witness .
text2: Patiesi , patiesi , es tev saku : Mēs runājam , ko zinām , un liecinām , ko redzam , bet jūs mūsu liecību nepieņemat .

text: If I have told you earthly things , and ye believe not , how shall ye believe , if I tell you of heavenly things ?
text2: Ja jūs neticat , kad es jums runāju par zemes dzīvi , kā tad jūs ticēsiet , ja es jums stāstīšu par debess lietām ?

text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven , but he that came down from heaven , even the Son of man which is in heaven .
text2: Un neviens neuziet debesīs , kā vienīgi Cilvēka Dēls , kas nācis no debesīm un kas ir debesīs .

text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness , even so must the Son of man be lifted up :
text2: Un kā Mozus uzcēla čūsku tuksnesī , tāpat jābūt paaugstinātam Cilvēka Dēlam ;

text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have eternal life .
text2: Lai katrs , kas uz Viņu tic , neieiet pazušanā , bet iemanto mūžīgo dzīvi .

text: For God so loved the world , that he gave his only begotten Son , that whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have everlasting life .
text2: Jo Dievs tā mīlēja pasauli , ka deva savu vienpiedzimušo Dēlu , lai ikviens , kas uz Viņu tic , nepazūd , bet iegūst mūžīgo dzīvību .

text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world ; but that the world through him might be saved .
text2: Jo Dievs nesūtīja savu Dēlu pasaulē , lai Viņš pasauli tiesātu , bet lai pasaule tiktu caur Viņu pestīta .

text: He that believeth on him is not condemned : but he that believeth not is condemned already , because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God .
text2: Kas uz Viņu tic , tas netiek tiesāts , bet , kas netic , tas tāpēc notiesāts , ka netic Dieva vienpiedzimušā Dēla vārdam .

text: And this is the condemnation , that light is come into the world , and men loved darkness rather than light , because their deeds were evil .
text2: Bet šī ir jau tiesa , ka gaisma nāca pasaulē ; bet cilvēki vairāk mīlēja tumsu nekā gaismu , jo viņu darbi bija ļauni .

text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light , neither cometh to the light , lest his deeds should be reproved .
text2: Jo ikviens , kas dara ļaunu , ienīst gaismu un nenāk pie gaismas , lai viņa darbi netiktu nopelti .

text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light , that his deeds may be made manifest , that they are wrought in God .
text2: Bet , kas dara patiesību , tas nāk pie gaismas , lai viņa darbi atklājas , jo tie darīti Dievā .

text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea ; and there he tarried with them , and baptized .
text2: Pēc tam Jēzus un Viņa mācekļi aizgāja Jūdejas zemē un tur uzturējās ar viņiem , un kristīja .

text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim , because there was much water there : and they came , and were baptized .
text2: Bet Jānis kristīja Ainonā pie Salimas , jo tur bija daudz ūdens ; un tie nāca un kristījās ,

text: For John was not yet cast into prison .
text2: Jo Jānis vēl nebija ieslodzīts cietumā .

text: Then there arose a question between some of John ' s disciples and the Jews about purifying .
text2: Bet starp Jāņa mācekļiem un jūdiem izcēlās strīds par šķīstīšanos .

text: And they came unto John , and said unto him , Rabbi , he that was with thee beyond Jordan , to whom thou barest witness , behold , the same baptizeth , and all men come to him .
text2: Un tie nāca pie Jāņa un sacīja viņam : Rabbi ! Tas , kas ar tevi bija viņpus Jordānas , par ko tu nodevi liecību , lūk , Viņš kristī , un visi iet pie Viņa .

text: John answered and said , A man can receive nothing , except it be given him from heaven .
text2: Jānis atbildēja , sacīdams : Cilvēks nekā nevar ņemt , ja viņam netiek dots no debesīm .

text: Ye yourselves bear me witness , that I said , I am not the Christ , but that I am sent before him .
text2: Jūs paši man liecināt par to , ko sacīju : Es neesmu Kristus , bet esmu sūtīts pirms Viņa .

text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom : but the friend of the bridegroom , which standeth and heareth him , rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom ' s voice : this my joy therefore is fulfilled .
text2: Kam ir līgava , tas ir līgavainis ; bet līgavaiņa draugs , kas stāv un klausās viņā , priekā priecājas par līgavaiņa balsi . Šis mans prieks tad nu piepildījies .

text: He must increase , but I must decrease .
text2: Viņam vajaga augt , bet man mazināties .

text: He that cometh from above is above all : he that is of the earth is earthly , and speaketh of the earth : he that cometh from heaven is above all .
text2: Kas nāk no augšienes , tas ir pār visiem . Kas no zemes , tas ir no zemes un par zemi runā . Kas nāk no debesīm , tas ir pār visiem .

text: And what he hath seen and heard , that he testifieth ; and no man receiveth his testimony .
text2: Un ko Viņš redzēja un dzirdēja , par to Viņš liecina ; bet Viņa liecību neviens nepieņem .

text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true .
text2: Kas Viņa liecību pieņēmis , tas apzīmogojis , ka Dievs ir patiesīgs .

text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God : for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him .
text2: Jo , ko Dievs sūtījis , tas runā Dieva vārdus , jo Dievs nedod Garu mērīdams .

text: The Father loveth the Son , and hath given all things into his hand .
text2: Tēvs mīl Dēlu un visu ir nodevis Viņa rokā .

text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life : and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life ; but the wrath of God abideth on him .
text2: Kas tic uz Dēlu , tam ir mūžīgā dzīvība ; bet , kas Dēlam netic , tas dzīvības neredzēs , bet Dieva dusmas paliek pār viņu .

text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John ,
text2: Kad Jēzus uzzināja , ka farizeji bija dzirdējuši , ka Jēzus kristī un iegūst vairāk mācekļu nekā Jānis ,

text: ( Though Jesus himself baptized not , but his disciples , )
text2: ( Lai gan Jēzus nekristīja , bet Viņa mācekļi ) ,

text: He left Judaea , and departed again into Galilee .
text2: Tad Viņš atstāja Jūdeju un aizgāja atkal uz Galileju .

text: And he must needs go through Samaria .
text2: Bet Viņam bija jāiet caur Samariju .

text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria , which is called Sychar , near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph .
text2: Tad Viņš nonāca Samarijas pilsētā , kas saucās Sihāra , netālu no tīruma , ko Jēkabs bija devis savam dēlam Jāzepam .

text: Now Jacob ' s well was there . Jesus therefore , being wearied with his journey , sat thus on the well : and it was about the sixth hour .
text2: Tur bija Jēkaba aka . Tad Jēzus , noguris ceļā , apsēdās pie akas . Bija apmēram sestā stunda .

text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water : Jesus saith unto her , Give me to drink .
text2: No Samarijas atnāca sieviete smelt ūdeni . Jēzus sacīja viņai : Dod man dzert !

text: ( For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat . )
text2: ( Jo Viņa mācekļi bija aizgājuši uz pilsētu , lai iepirktu pārtiku . )

text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him , How is it that thou , being a Jew , askest drink of me , which am a woman of Samaria ? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans .
text2: Tad šī samariešu sieviete sacīja Viņam : Kā Tu , būdams jūds , prasi no manis , samarietes , dzert ? Jo jūdi nesaietas ar samariešiem .

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , If thou knewest the gift of God , and who it is that saith to thee , Give me to drink ; thou wouldest have asked of him , and he would have given thee living water .
text2: Jēzus atbildēja viņai , sacīdams : Ja tu pazītu Dieva dāvanu un kas ir Tas , kas tev saka : dod man dzert , tad tu gan no Viņa lūgtu ; un Viņš tev dotu dzīvo ūdeni .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , thou hast nothing to draw with , and the well is deep : from whence then hast thou that living water ?
text2: Sieviete sacīja Viņam : Kungs Tev nav ar ko smelt , bet aka dziļa ; no kurienes tad Tev dzīvais ūdens ?

text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob , which gave us the well , and drank thereof himself , and his children , and his cattle ?
text2: Vai Tu esi lielāks par mūsu tēvu Jēkabu , kas mums šo aku devis , un pats viņš no tās dzēra un viņa bērni , un viņa dzīvnieki ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again :
text2: Jēzus atbildēja viņai un sacīja : Ikvienam , kas šo ūdeni dzer , atkal slāpst , bet kas dzers to ūdeni , ko es viņam došu , tam ne mūžam vairs neslāps .

text: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst ; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life .
text2: Bet ūdens , ko es tam došu , kļūs par ūdens avotu , kas verd mūžīgai dzīvei .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , give me this water , that I thirst not , neither come hither to draw .
text2: Sieviete sacīja Viņam : Kungs , Dod man šo ūdeni , lai man neslāpst un nav jānāk šurp smelt !

text: Jesus saith unto her , Go , call thy husband , and come hither .
text2: Jēzus sacīja viņai : Ej , pasauc savu vīru un nāc šurp !

text: The woman answered and said , I have no husband . Jesus said unto her , Thou hast well said , I have no husband :
text2: Sieviete atbildēja un sacīja : Man nav vīra . Jēzus sacīja viņai : Tu pareizi pateici : man nav vīra .

text: For thou hast had five husbands ; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband : in that saidst thou truly .
text2: Jo pieci vīri tev bijuši , bet , kas tev tagad ir , tas nav tavs vīrs . To tu pareizi teici .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , I perceive that thou art a prophet .
text2: Sieviete Viņam sacīja : Kungs ! Redzu , ka Tu esi pravietis .

text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain ; and ye say , that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship .
text2: Mūsu tēvi lūdza Dievu šinī kalnā , bet jūs sakāt , ka Jeruzaleme ir tā vieta , kur Dievu vajag pielūgt .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , believe me , the hour cometh , when ye shall neither in this mountain , nor yet at Jerusalem , worship the Father .
text2: Jēzus sacīja viņai : Sieviet , tici man , ka nāk stunda , kad jūs Tēvu nepielūgsiet ne šinī kalnā , ne Jeruzalemē !

text: Ye worship ye know not what : we know what we worship : for salvation is of the Jews .
text2: Jūs pielūdzat , ko nezināt ; mēs pielūdzam , ko zinām , jo pestīšana nāk no jūdiem .

text: But the hour cometh , and now is , when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth : for the Father seeketh such to worship him .
text2: Nāk stunda , un tagad tā ir , kad īstie dievlūdzēji pielūgs Tēvu garā un patiesībā , jo arī Tēvs meklē tādus , kas Viņu pielūdz .

text: God is a Spirit : and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth .
text2: Dievs ir Gars ; un kas Viņu pielūdz , tiem Viņš ir jāpielūdz garā un patiesībā .

text: The woman saith unto him , I know that Messias cometh , which is called Christ : when he is come , he will tell us all things .
text2: Sieviete sacīja Viņam : Es zinu , ka nāk Mesija ( ko sauc Kristus ) . Kad Viņš atnāks , tad visu mums pasludinās .

text: Jesus saith unto her , I that speak unto thee am he .
text2: Jēzus sacīja viņai : Es tas esmu , kas ar tevi runā .

text: And upon this came his disciples , and marvelled that he talked with the woman : yet no man said , What seekest thou ? or , Why talkest thou with her ?
text2: Un tūdaļ atnāca Viņa mācekļi un brīnījās , ka Viņš sarunājas ar sievieti . Tomēr neviens neteica : Ko vēlies ? vai : Ko runā ar viņu ?

text: The woman then left her waterpot , and went her way into the city , and saith to the men ,
text2: Tad sieviete atstāja savu ūdenstrauku , aizgāja uz pilsētu un sacīja turienes ļaudīm :

text: Come , see a man , which told me all things that ever I did : is not this the Christ ?
text2: Nāciet un skatieties cilvēku , kas man visu pateica , ko esmu darījusi ! Vai Viņš nav Kristus ?

text: Then they went out of the city , and came unto him .
text2: Tad tie aizgāja no pilsētas un nogāja pie Viņa .

text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him , saying , Master , eat .
text2: Tanī laikā mācekļi lūdza Viņu , sacīdami : Rabbi , ēd !

text: But he said unto them , I have meat to eat that ye know not of .
text2: Bet Viņš tiem sacīja : Man ir barība , ko ēst , ko jūs nepazīstat .

text: Therefore said the disciples one to another , Hath any man brought him ought to eat ?
text2: Tad mācekļi runāja savā starpā : Vai kāds Viņam atnesis ēst ?

text: Jesus saith unto them , My meat is to do the will of him that sent me , and to finish his work .
text2: Jēzus sacīja viņiem : Mana barība ir izpildīt Tā gribu , kas mani sūtījis , lai es pabeigtu Viņa darbu .

text: Say not ye , There are yet four months , and then cometh harvest ? behold , I say unto you , Lift up your eyes , and look on the fields ; for they are white already to harvest .
text2: Vai jūs nesakāt : Vēl četri mēneši , tad nāk pļauja . Lūk , es saku jums : paceliet savas acis un skatiet druvas , jo tās jau baltas pļaujai !

text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages , and gathereth fruit unto life eternal : that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together .
text2: Un pļāvējs saņem algu un savāc augļus mūžīgai dzīvei , lai kopīgi priecātos sējējs un pļāvējs .

text: And herein is that saying true , One soweth , and another reapeth .
text2: Jo še piepildās vārds , ka cits ir , kas sēj , un cits , kas pļauj .

text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour : other men laboured , and ye are entered into their labours .
text2: Es jūs sūtīju pļaut to , ko jūs neesat iestrādājuši . Citi strādāja , bet jūs iegājāt viņu darbā .

text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman , which testified , He told me all that ever I did .
text2: Bet daudzi šās pilsētas samarieši ticēja Viņam sievietes vārdu dēļ , kas deva liecību : Viņš man visu pateica , ko biju darījusi .

text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him , they besought him that he would tarry with them : and he abode there two days .
text2: Kad samarieši atnāca pie Viņa , tie lūdza Viņu palikt pie tiem , un Viņš palika tur divas dienas .

text: And many more believed because of his own word ;
text2: Un vēl lielāks vairums uz Viņu ticēja Viņa vārdu dēļ .

text: And said unto the woman , Now we believe , not because of thy saying : for we have heard him ourselves , and know that this is indeed the Christ , the Saviour of the world .
text2: Un viņi sacīja sievietei : Ne jau tavas runas dēļ mēs ticam , jo paši mēs dzirdējām un uzzinājām , ka Viņš ir patiesi pasaules Pestītājs .

text: Now after two days he departed thence , and went into Galilee .
text2: Bet pēc divām dienām Viņš aizgāja no turienes un devās uz Galileju ;

text: For Jesus himself testified , that a prophet hath no honour in his own country .
text2: Jo pats Jēzus apliecināja , ka pravietis savā tēvijā netiek cienīts .

text: Then when he was come into Galilee , the Galilaeans received him , having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast : for they also went unto the feast .
text2: Kad Viņš nonāca Galilejā , tad galilejieši uzņēma Viņu , jo tie visu bija redzējuši , ko Viņš svētkos darīja Jeruzalemē , jo paši bija svētkos .

text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee , where he made the water wine . And there was a certain nobleman , whose son was sick at Capernaum .
text2: Tad Viņš atkal nonāca Galilejas Kānā , kur Viņš ūdeni bija pārvērtis vīnā . Un Kafarnaumā bija kāds galminieks , kura dēls slimoja .

text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee , he went unto him , and besought him that he would come down , and heal his son : for he was at the point of death .
text2: Šis , izdzirdis , ka Jēzus no Jūdejas atnācis Galilejā , aizgāja pie Viņa un lūdza Viņu atnākt un izdziedināt tā dēlu , jo tas bija pie miršanas .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Except ye see signs and wonders , ye will not believe .
text2: Tad Jēzus sacīja viņam : Ja jūs zīmes un brīnumus neredzat , jūs neticat .

text: The nobleman saith unto him , Sir , come down ere my child die .
text2: Galminieks sacīja Viņam : Kungs , nāc , iekams mans dēls nav miris !

text: Jesus saith unto him , Go thy way ; thy son liveth . And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him , and he went his way .
text2: Jēzus sacīja viņam : Ej , tavs dēls dzīvo ! Cilvēks ticēja vārdiem , ko Jēzus viņam teica , un aizgāja .

text: And as he was now going down , his servants met him , and told him , saying , Thy son liveth .
text2: Bet , viņam jau ejot , kalpi atsteidzās tam pretim un ziņoja , sacīdami , ka viņa dēls dzīvo .

text: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend . And they said unto him , Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him .
text2: Tad viņš jautāja tiem par stundu , kad tam palicis labāk . Un tie sacīja viņam : Vakar ap septīto stundu drudzis viņu atstāja .

text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour , in the which Jesus said unto him , Thy son liveth : and himself believed , and his whole house .
text2: Tad tēvs noprata , ka tā bija tā stunda , kad Jēzus sacīja viņam : Tavs dēls dzīvo . Un viņš ticēja pats un viss viņa nams .

text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did , when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee .
text2: Šis bija jau otrs brīnums , ko Jēzus padarīja , atnācis no Jūdejas Galilejā .

text: After this there was a feast of the Jews ; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Pēc tam bija jūdu svētki ; un Jēzus aizgāja uz Jeruzalemi .

text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool , which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda , having five porches .
text2: Bet Jeruzalemē bija ar piecām pajumtēm Avju dīķis , kas ebrejiski saucas Betsata .

text: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk , of blind , halt , withered , waiting for the moving of the water .
text2: Tanīs gulēja liels daudzums slimnieku , aklo , klibo un izkaltušo , kas gaidīja ūdens sakustēšanos .

text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool , and troubled the water : whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had .
text2: Bet Kunga eņģelis savulaik nolaidās dīķī ; un kas pirmais pēc ūdens sakustēšanās iekāpa dīķī , tas izveseļojās , lai ar kādu slimību viņš neslimotu .

text: And a certain man was there , which had an infirmity thirty and eight years .
text2: Bet tur bija kāds cilvēks , kas slimoja trīsdesmit astoņus gadus .

text: When Jesus saw him lie , and knew that he had been now a long time in that case , he saith unto him , Wilt thou be made whole ?
text2: Jēzus , redzēdams viņu guļam un zinādams , ka tas jau ilgu laiku slimo , sacīja viņam : Vai gribi būt vesels ?

text: The impotent man answered him , Sir , I have no man , when the water is troubled , to put me into the pool : but while I am coming , another steppeth down before me .
text2: Slimais atbildēja Viņam : Kungs , man nav cilvēka , kas mani ievestu dīķī , kad ūdens sakustas , jo , kamēr es aizeju , cits ieiet pirmais .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Rise , take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Jēzus sacīja viņam : Celies , ņem savu gultu un staigā .

text: And immediately the man was made whole , and took up his bed , and walked : and on the same day was the sabbath .
text2: Un tūdaļ šis cilvēks izveseļojās , ņēma savu gultu un staigāja . Bet bija sabata diena .

text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured , It is the sabbath day : it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed .
text2: Tad jūdi sacīja izdziedinātajam : Ir sabats ! Tev nav brīv nest savu gultu !

text: He answered them , He that made me whole , the same said unto me , Take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Viņš tiem atbildēja : Kas mani izdziedināja , tas teica man : ņem savu gultu un staigā !

text: Then asked they him , What man is that which said unto thee , Take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Tad tie jautāja viņam : Kas ir tas cilvēks , kas tev sacīja : ņem savu gultu un staigā ?

text: And he that was healed wist not who it was : for Jesus had conveyed himself away , a multitude being in that place .
text2: Bet izdziedinātais nezināja , kas Tas bija , jo Jēzus aizgāja no ļaudīm , kas atradās tanī vietā .

text: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple , and said unto him , Behold , thou art made whole : sin no more , lest a worse thing come unto thee .
text2: Vēlāk Jēzus atrada viņu svētnīcā un sacīja tam : Lūk , tu esi izdziedināts ; negrēko vairs , lai tev kas ļaunāks nenotiek .

text: The man departed , and told the Jews that it was Jesus , which had made him whole .
text2: Tas cilvēks aizgāja un paziņoja jūdiem , ka Jēzus ir tas , kas viņu izdziedināja .

text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus , and sought to slay him , because he had done these things on the sabbath day .
text2: Tāpēc jūdi vajāja Jēzu , ka Viņš to darīja sabatā .

text: But Jesus answered them , My Father worketh hitherto , and I work .
text2: Bet Jēzus atbildēja viņiem : Mans Tēvs aizvien darbojas , un es arī darbojos .

text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him , because he not only had broken the sabbath , but said also that God was his Father , making himself equal with God .
text2: Tāpēc jūdi vēl vairāk meklēja Viņu nonāvēt , ka Viņš ne tikai neievēroja sabatu , bet sauca Dievu par savu Tēvu , pielīdzinādams sevi Dievam . Tad Jēzus atbildēja un sacīja viņiem :

text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , The Son can do nothing of himself , but what he seeth the Father do : for what things soever he doeth , these also doeth the Son likewise .
text2: Patiesi , patiesi es jums saku : Dēls no sevis neko nevar darīt , ja neredzēs Tēvu darām ; jo , ko Viņš dara , to tāpat dara arī Dēls .

text: For the Father loveth the Son , and sheweth him all things that himself doeth : and he will shew him greater works than these , that ye may marvel .
text2: Jo Tēvs mīl Dēlu un rāda Viņam visu , ko pats dara , un rādīs Viņam vēl lielākus darbus nekā šos , lai jūs brīnītos .

text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead , and quickeneth them ; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will .
text2: Jo kā Tēvs uzmodina miroņus un atdzīvina , tā arī Dēls atdzīvina , kurus vēlas .

text: For the Father judgeth no man , but hath committed all judgment unto the Son :
text2: Jo Tēvs netiesā nevienu , bet visu tiesu nodevis Dēlam ,

text: That all men should honour the Son , even as they honour the Father . He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him .
text2: Lai visi tāpat godātu Dēlu , kā godā Tēvu . Kas Dēlu negodina , tas negodina Tēvu , kas Viņu sūtījis .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that heareth my word , and believeth on him that sent me , hath everlasting life , and shall not come into condemnation ; but is passed from death unto life .
text2: Patiesi , patiesi es jums saku : Kas manus vārdus klausa un tic uz To , kas mani sūtījis , tam ir mūžīgā dzīvība ; un viņš tiesā nenāk , bet no nāves pāriet dzīvībā .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The hour is coming , and now is , when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God : and they that hear shall live .
text2: Patiesi , patiesi es jums saku , ka nāk stunda , un tā tagad ir , kad miroņi dzirdēs Dieva Dēla balsi , un tie , kas dzirdēs , dzīvos .

text: For as the Father hath life in himself ; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself ;
text2: Jo kā Tēvam ir dzīvība pašam sevī , tā Viņš arī Dēlam devis , lai Viņam būtu dzīvība pašam sevī .

text: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also , because he is the Son of man .
text2: Un deva Viņam varu tiesāt , jo Viņš ir Cilvēka Dēls .

text: Marvel not at this : for the hour is coming , in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice ,
text2: Nebrīnieties par to , jo nāk stunda , kurā visi , kas atrodas kapos , dzirdēs Dieva balsi ,

text: And shall come forth ; they that have done good , unto the resurrection of life ; and they that have done evil , unto the resurrection of damnation .
text2: Un izies tie , kas labu darījuši , uz augšāmcelšanos dzīvībai , bet tie , kas ļaunu darījuši , uz augšāmcelšanos tiesai .

text: I can of mine own self do nothing : as I hear , I judge : and my judgment is just ; because I seek not mine own will , but the will of the Father which hath sent me .
text2: Es pats no sevis nekā nevaru darīt . Kā es dzirdu , tā es tiesāju ; un mana tiesa ir taisnīga , jo es nemeklēju savu gribu , bet tā , kas mani sūtījis .

text: If I bear witness of myself , my witness is not true .
text2: Ja es pats dodu liecību par sevi , mana liecība nav patiesa .

text: There is another that beareth witness of me ; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true .
text2: Ir Cits , kas liecina par mani ; un es zinu , ka liecība , kādu Viņš par mani dod , ir patiesa .

text: Ye sent unto John , and he bare witness unto the truth .
text2: Jūs sūtījāt pie Jāņa ; un viņš deva liecību patiesībai .

text: But I receive not testimony from man : but these things I say , that ye might be saved .
