text2: Pēc tam viņš , aizgājis no Atēnām , nonāca Korintā .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Un viņš atrada kādu jūdu , vārdā Akvilu , kas cēlies no Pontas . Tas ar savu sievu Priskillu nupat kā bija atnācis no Itālijas ( jo Klaudijs bija pavēlējis visiem jūdiem atstāt Romu ) . Tiem viņš piebiedrojās .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: Un tā kā viņam bija tas pats amats , viņš palika pie tiem un strādāja . ( Viņiem bija telšu taisītāju amats . )

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: Un viņš katru sabatu mācīja sinagogā un , runādams par Kunga Jēzus vārdu , pārliecināja jūdus un grieķus .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Bet kad Sīls un Timotejs atnāca no Maķedonijas , Pāvils vēl centīgāk sludināja jūdiem , ka Jēzus ir Kristus .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: Bet kad tie runāja pretim un zaimoja , viņš , izkratījis savas drēbes , sacīja tiem : Jūsu asinis lai nāk pār jūsu galvām . No šī brīža es iešu pie pagāniem .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Un viņš , no turienes aizgājis , nonāca kāda dievbijīga vīra namā , kam vārds bija Tits Justs . Tā nams bija savienots ar sinagogu .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Bet Krisps , sinagogas priekšnieks , un viss viņa nams ticēja uz Kungu , un daudzi korintieši , dzirdēdami , kļuva ticīgi un kristījās .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Tad naktī Kungs parādībā sacīja Pāvilam : Nebīsties , bet runā un neklusē ,

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: Jo es esmu ar tevi , un neviens tevi neaiztiks , lai darītu tev ļaunu , jo man ir daudz ļaužu šinī pilsētā .

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Tad viņš tur palika gadu un sešus mēnešus , tiem mācīdams Dieva vārdu .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Bet kad Gallions bija prokonsuls Ahajā , jūdi vienprātīgi sacēlās pret Pāvilu un veda viņu tiesā ,

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: Sacīdami : Šis pierunā ļaudis kalpot Dievam pret likumu .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Kad Pāvils sāka atvērt muti , Gallions sacīja jūdiem : Jūdu vīri , ja tas būtu kāds netaisns vai ļauns noziegums , es jūs , kā pienākas , uzklausītu ,

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: Bet ja strīdi ir par mācību , vārdiem un jūsu bauslību , tad lūkojiet paši ; es negribu tanīs būt tiesnesis .

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Un viņš tos noraidīja no tribunāla .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Tad visi , notvēruši sinagogas priekšnieku Sostenu , sita to tribunāla priekšā , bet Gallions neraizējās par viņiem .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: Bet Pāvils uzturējās tur vēl daudz dienas un , atvadījies no brāļiem , pārcēlās uz Sīriju , bet kopā ar viņu Priskilla un Akvila , kas Kenhrejā apcirpa savu galvu , jo tāds bija viņa solījums .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Viņš nonāca Efezā un atstāja tos tur , bet pats , iegājis sinagogā , sarunājās ar jūdiem .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Tie lūdza viņu palikt ilgāku laiku , bet viņš . nepiekrita ,

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: Bet atvadīdamies viņš teica : Ja tāds būs Dieva prāts , es atkal atgriezīšos pie jums . Tad viņš aizgāja no Efezas .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Un viņš , nonācis Cēzarejā , aizgāja un apsveica draudzi , un devās uz Antiohiju .

text: And after he had spent some time there , he departed , and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples .
text2: Un kādu laiku tur palicis , viņš aizgāja ; pārstaigādams pēc kārtas Galatijas apgabalu un Frīģiju , viņš stiprināja visus mācekļus .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Bet Efezā nonāca kāds jūds , vārdā Apolls , dzimis aleksandrietis , labs Rakstu pazinējs un daiļrunīgs .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Viņš bija mācīts Kunga ceļā un dedzīgs garā , runāja un cītīgi mācīja to , kas attiecas uz Jēzu , pats pazīdams tikai Jāņa kristību .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Viņš droši sāka sludināt sinagogā . To dzirdējuši , Priskilla un Akvila paņēma viņu pie sevis un vēl rūpīgāk paskaidroja viņam Kunga ceļu .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Kad viņš gribēja iet uz Ahaju , brāļi viņu pamācīja un rakstīja mācekļiem , lai viņu uzņem . Tur nonācis , viņš kļuva noderīgs tiem , kas ticēja ;

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Jo viņš atklāti un stipri atspēkoja jūdus , pierādīdams ar Rakstiem , ka Jēzus ir Kristus .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Bet notika , kamēr Apolls bija Korintā , ka Pāvils , pārstaigājis augstienes apgabalus , nonāca Efezā . Atradis dažus mācekļus ,

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: Viņš tiem sacīja : Vai jūs saņēmāt Svēto Garu , kad kļuvāt ticīgi ? Bet tie viņam sacīja : Mēs pat neesam dzirdējuši , ka Svētais Gars ir .

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Tad viņš tiem sacīja : Kā tad jūs esat kristīti ? Tie sacīja : Jāņa kristībā .

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Bet Pāvils sacīja : Jānis kristīja tautu grēku nožēlošanas kristībā , sacīdams , lai tie tic uz To , kas pēc viņa nāks , t . i . , uz Jēzu .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: To dzirdējuši , viņi tika kristīti Kunga Jēzus vārdā .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Un kad Pāvils uzlika tiem rokas , Svētais Gars nāca uz viņiem , un tie runāja valodās un pravietoja .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Bet viņu bija pavisam ap divpadsmit vīru .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Tad viņš , iegājis sinagogā , droši sludināja trīs mēnešus , mācīdams un pārliecinādams par Dieva valstību .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: Bet kad daži palika cietsirdīgi un neticēja , ļaužu priekšā zaimodami Kunga ceļu , viņš no tiem aizgāja , nošķīra mācekļus un katru dienu tiem sludināja Tiranna skolā .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Tas turpinājās divus gadus , tā ka visi , kas Āzijā dzīvoja , jūdi un pagāni dzirdēja Kunga vārdu .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Dievs ar Pāvila rokām darīja ne mazums brīnumu ,

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: Tā ka pat sviedrautus un priekšautus no viņa miesas uzlika neveselajiem , un slimības tos atstāja , un ļaunie gari izgāja no tiem .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Bet daži no jūdiem , kas bija garu izdzinēji un klejoja apkārt , mēģināja piesaukt Jēzus vārdu pār tiem , kam bija ļaunie gari , sacīdami : Es jūs zvērinu pie Jēzus , ko Pāvils sludina .

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: Bet tie , kas to darīja , bija dažī jūdi : augstā priestera Skevas septiņi dēli .

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Bet ļaunais gars tiem atbildēja , sacīdams : Jēzu es pazīstu un Pāvilu es zinu , bet kas jūs esat ?

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Un cilvēks , kurā bija ļaunais gars , uzbruka tiem , ņēma pār abiem virsroku un pieveica tos , tā ka tie kaili un ievainoti aizbēga no tās mājas .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Tas kļuva zināms visiem jūdiem un pagāniem , kas dzīvoja Efezā , un visus tos pārņēma bailes , un viņi godināja Kunga Jēzus vārdu .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Un daudzi no ticīgajiem nāca , atzīdami un izstāstīdami savus darbus .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Bet daudzi no tiem , kas nodarbojās ar māņticību , sanesa grāmatas un visu priekšā sadedzināja . Noteicot to vērtību , atrada , ka tā ir piecdesmit tūkstošu denāriju .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Tā Dieva vārds vareni auga un nostiprinājās .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: To pabeidzis , Pāvils garā apņēmās , pārstaigājot Maķedoniju un Ahaju , iet uz Jeruzalemi , sacīdams : Kad es būšu tur bijis , man būs jāredz arī Roma .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Tad viņš , aizsūtījis uz Maķedoniju divus savus palīgus , Timoteju un Erastu , pats kādu laiku palika Āzijā .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Bet tanī laikā notika liels nemiers Kunga ceļa dēļ .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Jo kāds sudrabkalis , vārdā Dēmetrijs , kas darināja Diānas sudraba tempļus un sagādāja amatniekiem ne mazums peļņas ,

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Sasaucis tos un citus , kas strādāja to pašu amatu , sacīja : Vīri , jūs zināt , ka no šī darba mums ir ieguvums ;

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Un jūs redzat un dzirdat , ka šis Pāvils ne vien Efezā , bet gandrīz visā Āzijā pārliecina un novērš daudz tautas , sacīdams , ka tie nav dievi , kas rokām darināti .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Bet ne tikai šai mūsu nodarbei draud briesmas kļūt atmestai , bet arī lielās Diānas templis tiks nievāts un arī sāks iznīkt viņas godība , ko pielūdz visa Āzijā un pasaule .

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: To dzirdēdami un dusmu pārņemti , tie kliedza , sacīdami : Liela ir efeziešu Diāna !

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Un pilsētā cēlās nemiers . Tie vienprātīgi traucās uz teātri , raudami līdz maķedoniešus - Gaiju un Aristarhu , Pāvila ceļa biedrus .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: Kad Pāvils gribēja iet pie tautas , mācekļi to nepieļāva .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Bet arī daži no Āzijas dižciltīgajiem , kas bija viņa draugi , sūtīja pie viņa un lūdza , lai viņš neiet uz teātri .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: Bet daži kliedza citu , jo sanāksme bija izjukusi , un vairums nezināja , kāda iemesla dēļ viņi sanākuši .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Tad tie no pūļa izvilka Aleksandru , ko jūdi bīdīja uz priekšu . Bet Aleksandrs , pieprasījis ar roku klusēšanu , gribēja aizstāvēties tautas priekšā .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Uzzinājuši , ka viņš ir jūds , tie visi vienā balsī apmēram divas stundas kliedza : Liela ir efeziešu Diāna !

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: Bet rakstvedis nomierināja pūli , sacīdams : Efeziešu vīri , vai ir kāds cilvēks , kas nezinātu , ka efeziešu pilsēta ir lielās Diānas , Jupitera meitas , godinātāja ?

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Tā kā tam neviens nevar pretim runāt , jums jānomierinās , lai neko neapdomīgu nedarītu .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Jūs atvedāt šos cilvēkus , kas nav ne tempļa aplaupītāji , ne jūsu dieves zaimotāji .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Ja Dēmetrijam un amatniekiem , kas kopā ar viņu , ir kāda prasība pret citiem , tad notiek tiesu sanāksmes un ir arī prokonsuli , lai sūdz viens otru .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: Bet ja jums būtu vēl kāda cita prasība , to var izlemt likumīgā sanāksmē .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Mums arī jābīstas , ka mūs neapsūdz par šīs dienas sacelšanos , jo mēs nevaram uzrādīt , kas būtu pie dumpja vainojams . Un viņš to teicis , atlaida sanāksmi .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Pēc tam , kad nemiers bija norimis , Pāvils , saaicinājis mācekļus , pamācīja tos , atvadījās un devās ceļā , lai ietu uz Maķedoniju .

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: Bet pārstaigājis šos apgabalus un daudz vārdiem tos pamācījis , viņš nonāca Grieķijā .

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: Tur viņš , palicis trīs mēnešus , domāja pārcelties uz Sīriju , bet , tā kā jūdi viņam uzglūnēja , viņš nolēma atgriezties caur Maķedoniju .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: Viņu pavadīja berojietis Zopatrs , Pirra dēls , tesalonīķieši - Aristarhs un Sekunds , derbietis Gaijs , Timotejs un no Āzijas - Tihiks un Trofims .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Tie izgāja iepriekš un gaidīja mūs Troadā .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Mēs no Filipiem aizbraucām pēc neraudzētās maizes dienas un piecās dienās nonācām pie viņiem Troadā , kur palikām septiņas dienas .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Bet pirmajā nedēļas dienā , kad mēs sanācām maizi lauzt , Pāvils , gribēdams nākošajā dienā doties tālāk , runāja tiem ; un viņa runa ieilga līdz pusnaktij .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: Bet augšistabā , kur mēs sanācām , bija daudz lampadu .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Kad Pāvils tik ilgi runāja , tad kāds jauneklis , vārdā Eitihs , uz palodzes sēdēdams , iegrima dziļā miegā un , miega pārvarēts , nokrita no trešā stāva lejā un tika pacelts jau nedzīvs .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: Tad Pāvils , nokāpis zemē pie viņa , nometās pār viņu un , to apkampis , sacīja : Neuztraucieties , jo viņa dvēsele vēl viņā .

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Tad viņš , uzkāpis augšā , lauza maizi , baudīja to un , runājis pietiekoši līdz gaismai , aizceļoja .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: Bet zēnu tie aizveda dzīvu un ļoti priecājās .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: Tad mēs , iekāpuši kuģī , braucām uz Asu , gribēdami tur uzņemt Pāvilu , jo tā viņš , pats iedams pa zemes ceļu , mums pavēlēja .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: Kad viņš Asā ar mums satikās , mēs viņu uzņēmām un pārcēlāmies uz Mitilēni .

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: No turienes aizbraukuši , mēs nākošajā dienā nokļuvām iepretim Hijai , un otrā dienā mēs piestājāmies Samosā , bet nākošajā dienā nonācām Milētā ;

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
text2: Jo Pāvils nolēma braukt Efezai garām , lai neuzkavētos Āzijā . Viņš steidzās , lai , ja tas iespējams , Vasarsvētkus svinētu Jeruzalemē .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: No Milētas viņš sūtīja uz Efezu un ataicināja baznīcas vecākos .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Kad viņi atnāca un bija kopā ar to , viņš tiem sacīja : Jūs zināt , ka no pirmās dienas , kopš esmu atnācis Āzijā , es visu laiku biju pie jums ,

text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind , and with many tears , and temptations , which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews :
text2: Kalpodams Kungam visā pazemībā un asarās , un pārbaudījumos , ko man sagādāja jūdu vajāšanas ;

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: Arī neko noderīgu neesmu noklusējis , bet esmu jums sludinājis un jūs mācījis atklātībā un mājās ,

text: Testifying both to the Jews , and also to the Greeks , repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Apliecinādams jūdiem un pagāniem atgriešanos pie Dieva un ticību uz mūsu Kungu Jēzu Kristu .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: Un tagad , lūk , garā saistīts , es eju uz Jeruzalemi , nezinādams , kas man tur notiks .

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Tikai Svētais Gars man katrā pilsētā liecina , sacīdams , ka važas un apspiešana mani gaida Jeruzalemē .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: Bet no tā visa es nebīstos , un es nevērtēju savu dzīvību dārgāku par sevi , lai tikai pabeigtu savas gaitas un kalpošanu vārdam , ko esmu saņēmis no Kunga Jēzus , lai apliecinātu Dieva žēlastības evaņģēliju .

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: Un , lūk , tagad es zinu , ka jūs visi , kuru vidū esmu staigājis , sludinādams Dieva valstību , manu vaigu vairs neredzēsiet .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Tāpēc es šinī dienā apstiprinu jums , ka esmu tīrs no visu asinīm .

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: Jo es neesmu atturējies sludināt jums visu Dieva prātu .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: Uzmaniet paši sevi un visu ganāmo pulku , kurā Svētais Gars jūs iecēlis par bīskapiem , lai ganītu Dieva Baznīcu , ko Viņš ar savām asinīm ieguvis .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Es zinu , ka pēc manas aiziešanas pie jums iebruks plēsīgi vilki , kas nesaudzēs ganāmo pulku .

text: Also of your own selves shall men arise , speaking perverse things , to draw away disciples after them .
text2: No jums pašiem celsies vīri , runādami aplamības , lai aizrautu mācekļus sev līdz .

text: Therefore watch , and remember , that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears .
text2: Tāpēc esiet nomodā , pieminēdami , ka es trīs gadus dienām un naktīm nemitējos ar asarām ikvienu no jums pamācīt !

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: Un tagad es jūs novēlu Dievam un Viņa žēlastības vārdam , kas spēj celt un dot mantojumu ar visiem svētajiem .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: Sudrabu un zeltu vai drēbes ne no viena neesmu iekārojis .

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: Jūs paši zināt , ka šīs manas rokas gādāja par to , kas bija vajadzīgs man un tiem , kas pie manis ir .

text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: Es jums visu esmu rādījis , ka , tā strādājot , jāuzņem vājie , atminēdamies Kunga Jēzus vārdu , ko Viņš sacījis : Svētīgāk ir dot nekā ņemt .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: Un viņš , to sacījis , ceļos nometies , kopā ar viņiem visiem lūdza Dievu .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Bet visi gauži raudāja , metās Pāvilam ap kaklu un skūpstīja viņu ,

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: Visvairāk noskumdami par vārdiem , ko viņš sacīja , ka tie vairs viņa vaigu neredzēs . Un tie pavadīja viņu līdz kuģim .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Bet notika , ka mēs no viņiem šķīrāmies . Taisnā ceļā braukdami , nonācām Kosā un nākošajā dienā Rodā , un no turienes Patrā ;

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Un mēs , atraduši kuģi , kas brauc uz Feniķiju , iekāpām un aizbraucām .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Bet kad ieraudzījām Kipru un atstājām to pa kreisi , braucām uz Sīriju un nonācām Tirā , jo tur kuģim bija jāizkrauj krava .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Atraduši mācekļus , mēs tur palikām septiņas dienas . Tie , Gara pamudināti , sacīja Pāvilam , lai viņš neiet uz Jeruzalemi .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Kad šīs dienas bija pagājušas , mēs kājām devāmies ceļā . Visi kopā ar sievām un bērniem mūs pavadīja vēl ārpus pilsētas ; un mēs jūrmalā , ceļos nometušies , lūdzām Dievu .

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: Atvadījušies savā starpā , mēs iekāpām kuģī , bet viņi aizgāja savās mājās .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: No Tiras nonākuši Ptolemaidā , mēs pabeidzām jūras braucienu un , apsveikuši brāļus , palikām pie viņiem vienu dienu .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Bet nākošajā dienā mēs devāmies ceļā un nonācām Cēzarejā . Iegājuši evaņģēlista Filipa , kas bija viens no septiņiem , namā , mēs palikām pie viņa .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Viņam bija četras meitas , jaunavas , kuras pravietoja .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Un kad mēs tur dažas dienas uzkavējāmies , no Jūdejas atnāca kāds pravietis , vārdā Agabs .

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: Tas , ieradies pie mums , paņēma Pāvila jostu un , saistījis sev kājas un rokas , sacīja : To saka Svētais Gars : tā jūdi Jeruzalemē saistīs vīru , kam šī josta pieder , un nodos pagānu rokās .

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: To dzirdēdami , mēs un tie , kas tanī vietā bija , lūdzām , lai viņš neiet uz Jeruzalemi .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Tad Pāvils atbildēja un sacīja : Ko jūs darāt , kāpēc raudat un skumdināt manu sirdi ? Kunga Jēzus vārda dēļ es esmu sagatavojies , lai mani Jeruzalemē ne tikai sasietu , bet arī mirt .

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: Nespēdami viņu pierunāt , mēs nomierinājāmies , sacīdami : Lai notiek Kunga prāts !

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Pēc šīm dienām mēs sagatavojāmies un gājām uz Jeruzalemi .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Bet daži mācekļi no Cēzarejas nāca kopā ar mums . Viņi atveda līdz kādu kiprieti Mnasonu , seno mācekli , pie kura mums bija jāņem mājvieta .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Kad nonācām Jeruzalemē , brāļi mūs labprāt uzņēma .

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Nākošajā dienā Pāvils kopā ar mums aizgāja pie Jēkaba , kur sapulcējās visi vecākie .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: Tos apsveicis , viņš pēc kārtas izstāstīja , ko Dievs ar viņa kalpošanu darījis pagāniem .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: To dzirdējuši , tie godināja Dievu un sacīja viņam : Brāli , tu redzi , cik tūkstoši jūdu ir , kas palikuši ticīgi , un visi tie bauslības piekritēji .

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: Bet viņi dzirdēja par tevi , ka tu tos jūdus , kas dzīvo starp pagāniem , mācot atkrist no Mozus , sacīdams , ka tiem nevajagot apgraizīt savus bērnus un dzīvot pēc ieražām .

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: Ko darīt ? Katrā ziņā tautai jāsapulcējas , jo dzirdēs , ka tu atnācis .

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: Tāpēc dari to , ko mēs tev sakām . Mums ir četri vīri , kas devuši solījumus .

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: Ņem tos pie sevis , šķīsties kopā ar viņiem un samaksā par tiem , lai viņi apcērp galvas , tad visi zinās , ka tas , ko par tevi dzirdējuši , ir netaisnība , bet ka arī tu pats dzīvo pēc bauslības .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: Bet par tiem , kas no pagāniem kļuvuši ticīgi , mēs nolēmām un rakstījām , lai viņi sargās no tā , kas elkiem upurēts , un asinīm , un nožņaugtā , un netiklības .

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: Tad Pāvils , paņēmis vīrus pie sevis , nākošajā dienā kopā ar tiem šķīstījās , iegāja svētnīcā , pasludinādams šķīstīšanās dienu izbeigšanos , tiklīdz par ikvienu no tiem būšot upurēts upuris .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Bet kamēr pagāja septiņas dienas , tie jūdi , kas bija no Āzijas , redzēdami viņu svētnīcā , sakūdīja visu tautu un , sagrābuši viņu , kliedza :

text: Crying out , Men of Israel , help : This is the man , that teacheth all men every where against the people , and the law , and this place : and further brought Greeks also into the temple , and hath polluted this holy place .
text2: Izraēliešu vīri , palīdziet ! Šis ir tas cilvēks , kas visur visus māca pret tautu , bauslību un šo vietu ; turklāt arī pagānus viņš ievedis svētnīcā un tā apgānījis šo svēto vietu ;

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: Jo tie redzēja efezieti Trofimu pilsētā kopā ar viņu un domāja , ka Pāvils to ievedis svētnīcā .

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Tad visa pilsēta uztraucās , ļaudis saskrēja un , satvēruši Pāvilu , vilka to no svētnīcas ārā ; un tūdaļ durvis aizslēdza .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
text2: Kad tie gribēja viņu nonāvēt , tika paziņots sardzes priekšniekam , ka visā Jeruzalemē ir sacelšanās .

text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions , and ran down unto them : and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , they left beating of Paul .
text2: Paņēmis kareivjus un virsniekus , viņš tūdaļ aizskrēja pie tiem . Tie , redzēdami priekšnieku un kareivjus , mitējās sist Pāvilu .

text: Then the chief captain came near , and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains ; and demanded who he was , and what he had done .
text2: Tad priekšnieks piegāja , satvēra viņu , pavēlēja sasiet to divām važām un vaicāja , kas viņš tāds un ko viņš darījis ?

text: And some cried one thing , some another , among the multitude : and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult , he commanded him to be carried into the castle .
text2: Bet pūlī daži kliedza šo , citi to . Nevarēdams troksnī nekā noteikta uzzināt , viņš pavēlēja aizvest to uz kareivju mītni .

text: And when he came upon the stairs , so it was , that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people .
text2: Kad viņš nonāca līdz kāpnēm , notika , ka kareivji viņu nesa ļaužu uzmākšanās dēļ ;

text: For the multitude of the people followed after , crying , Away with him .
text2: Jo daudz ļaužu sekoja , kliegdami : Nost ar viņu !

text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle , he said unto the chief captain , May I speak unto thee ? Who said , Canst thou speak Greek ?
text2: Pirms Pāvilu ieveda kareivju mītnē , viņš sacīja priekšniekam : Vai man atļauts tev ko teikt ? Tas sacīja : Vai tu grieķiski proti ?

text: Art not thou that Egyptian , which before these days madest an uproar , and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers ?
text2: Vai tu neesi tas ēģiptietis , kas pirms dažām dienām sacēla dumpi un aizveda tuksnesī četrus tūkstošus sikariešu vīru ?

text: But Paul said , I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , a citizen of no mean city : and , I beseech thee , suffer me to speak unto the people .
text2: Un Pāvils sacīja viņam : Es esmu jūdu cilvēks , tarsietis , ievērojamās Kilikijas pilsētas pilsonis ; es tevi lūdzu , atļauj man runāt tautai .

text: And when he had given him licence , Paul stood on the stairs , and beckoned with the hand unto the people . And when there was made a great silence , he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue , saying ,
text2: Kad viņš to atļava , Pāvils , uz kāpnēm stāvēdams , māja ļaudīm ar roku un dziļam klusumam iestājoties , runāja ebreju valodā , sacīdams :

text: Men , brethren , and fathers , hear ye my defence which I make now unto you .
text2: Brāļi un tēvi , uzklausiet tagad aizstāvēšanos , kādu es jums teikšu !

text: ( And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them , they kept the more silence : and he saith , )
text2: Kad tie dzirdēja , ka viņš tos uzrunā ebreju valodā , tie kļuva vēl klusāki ,

text: I am verily a man which am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers , and was zealous toward God , as ye all are this day .
text2: Un viņš sacīja : Es esmu jūds , dzimis Tarsā , Kilikijā , bet uzaudzināts šinī pilsētā , izglītojies pie Gamaliēla kājām saskaņā ar tēvu bauslības patiesībām , bauslības cīnītājs , kādi arī jūs šodien visi esat ;

text: And I persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
text2: Un šo mācību esmu vajājis līdz nāvei , saistīdams un nododams cietumā vīriešus un sievietes ,

text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness , and all the estate of the elders : from whom also I received letters unto the brethren , and went to Damascus , to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem , for to be punished .
text2: Kā to man apliecina augstais priesteris un visi vecākie , no kuriem , saņēmis vēstules , gāju pie brāļiem uz Damasku , lai no turienes tos sasaistītus vestu uz Jeruzalemi un sodītu .

text: And it came to pass , that , as I made my journey , and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon , suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me .
text2: Bet notika , ka , man ejot un dienas vidū tuvojoties Damaskai , piepeši mani apspīdēja spilgta gaisma no debesīm .

text: And I fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Un es nokritu zemē un dzirdēju balsi man sakām : Saul , Saul , kāpēc tu mani vajā ?

text: And I answered , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said unto me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
text2: Bet es atbildēju : Kungs , kas tu esi ? Un Viņš sacīja man : Es esmu Jēzus Nācarietis , ko tu vajā .

text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light , and were afraid ; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
text2: Un tie , kas bija kopā ar mani , gaismu gan redzēja , bet Viņa balsi , kas ar mani runāja , nedzirdēja .

text: And I said , What shall I do , Lord ? And the Lord said unto me , Arise , and go into Damascus ; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do .
text2: Es sacīju : Kungs , kas man jādara ? Bet Kungs sacīja man : Celies , ej uz Damasku , un tur tev pateiks visu , kas tev jādara .

text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me , I came into Damascus .
text2: Un tā kā es no tās gaismas spilgtuma nevarēju vairs redzēt , pavadoņi veda mani aiz rokas , un tā es nonācu Damaskā .

text: And one Ananias , a devout man according to the law , having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there ,
text2: Tur Ananija , bauslības vīrs , par ko liecina visi tur dzīvojošie jūdi ,

text: Came unto me , and stood , and said unto me , Brother Saul , receive thy sight . And the same hour I looked up upon him .
text2: Atnāca un , nostājies pie manis , sacīja man : Brāli Saul , topi redzīgs ! Un es tanī pat stundā uzlūkoju viņu ,

text: And he said , The God of our fathers hath chosen thee , that thou shouldest know his will , and see that Just One , and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth .
text2: Bet viņš sacīja : Mūsu tēvu Dievs tevi izredzējis , lai tu atzītu Viņa prātu un redzētu Taisnīgo , un dzirdētu balsi no Viņa mutes ;

text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
text2: Jo tu visiem ļaudīm liecināsi par Viņu to , ko redzēji un dzirdēji .

text: And now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on the name of the Lord .
text2: Un ko tagad vēl kavējies ? Celies un pieņem kristību , un , Viņa vārdu piesaucis , nomazgā savus grēkus !

text: And it came to pass , that , when I was come again to Jerusalem , even while I prayed in the temple , I was in a trance ;
text2: Bet notika , kad atgriezos Jeruzalemē un svētnīcā lūdzu Dievu , ka es tiku garā aizrauts ;

text: And saw him saying unto me , Make haste , and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem : for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me .
text2: Un es redzēju Viņu man sakām : Steidzies un žigli izej no Jeruzalemes , jo viņi tavu liecību par mani nepieņems .

text: And I said , Lord , they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
text2: Un es sacīju : Kungs , viņi zina , ka es tos , kas uz Tevi ticēja , metu cietumā un šaustīju sinagogās .

text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting unto his death , and kept the raiment of them that slew him .
text2: Un kad Tava liecinieka Stefana asinis tika izlietas , es biju klāt un piekritu tam , un sargāju drēbes tiem , kas viņu nonāvēja .

text: And he said unto me , Depart : for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles .
text2: Un Viņš man sacīja : Ej , jo es tevi sūtīšu tālumā starp pagāniem .

text: And they gave him audience unto this word , and then lifted up their voices , and said , Away with such a fellow from the earth : for it is not fit that he should live .
text2: Uzklausījuši viņu līdz šiem vārdiem , tie pacēla savas balsis , sacīdami : Nost tādu no šīs zemes , jo tāds nedrīkst dzīvot !

text: And as they cried out , and cast off their clothes , and threw dust into the air ,
text2: Bet , kad tie kliedza un nometa savas drēbes , un svieda putekļus gaisā ,

text: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle , and bade that he should be examined by scourging ; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him .
text2: Priekšnieks lika viņu ievest mītnē , šaustīt rīkstēm un mocīt viņu , lai uzzinātu , kāda iemesla dēļ tie tā kliedza uz viņu .

text: And as they bound him with thongs , Paul said unto the centurion that stood by , Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman , and uncondemned ?
text2: Un kad tie sasēja viņu siksnām , Pāvils sacīja virsniekam , kas stāvēja viņam klāt : Vai jums atļauts šaustīt nenotiesātu Romas pilsoni ?

text: When the centurion heard that , he went and told the chief captain , saying , Take heed what thou doest : for this man is a Roman .
text2: To dzirdējis , virsnieks aizgāja pie priekšnieka un paziņoja viņam , sacīdams : Ko tu gribi darīt ? Šis cilvēks taču ir Romas pilsonis .

text: Then the chief captain came , and said unto him , Tell me , art thou a Roman ? He said , Yea .
text2: Tad priekšnieks , piegājis , jautāja viņam : Saki man , vai tu esi romietis ? Un viņš sacīja : Jā !

text: And the chief captain answered , With a great sum obtained I this freedom . And Paul said , But I was free born .
text2: Tad priekšnieks atbildēja : Es šo pilsonību ieguvu par augstu maksu . Un Pāvils sacīja : Bet es tāds jau esmu dzimis .

text: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him : and the chief captain also was afraid , after he knew that he was a Roman , and because he had bound him .
text2: Tad tūdaļ aizgāja no viņa tie , kas taisījās viņu mocīt . Bet priekšnieks , uzzinājis , ka viņš ir Romas pilsonis , izbijās , jo bija viņu saistījis .

text: On the morrow , because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews , he loosed him from his bands , and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear , and brought Paul down , and set him before them .
text2: Bet nākošajā dienā , gribēdams skaidrāk zināt , kāpēc jūdi viņu apsūdz , viņš to atbrīvoja un , pavēlējis sanākt priesteriem un visai augstajai tiesai , izveda Pāvilu un nostādīja viņu starp tiem .

text: And Paul , earnestly beholding the council , said , Men and brethren , I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day .
text2: Bet Pāvils , uzlūkodams augsto tiesu , sacīja : Vīri , brāļi , es pēc vislabākās sirdsapziņas esmu dzīvojis Dieva priekšā līdz pat šai dienai .

text: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth .
text2: Te augstais priesteris Ananija pavēlēja tiem , kas ap to stāvēja , sist viņam pa muti .

text: Then said Paul unto him , God shall smite thee , thou whited wall : for sittest thou to judge me after the law , and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law ?
text2: Tad Pāvils sacīja viņam : Dievs tevi sitīs , tu nobaltinātā siena ! Tu sēdi , lai mani tiesātu pēc likuma , bet pret likumu pavēli mani sist .

text: And they that stood by said , Revilest thou God ' s high priest ?
text2: Un klātesošie sacīja : Tu zaimo augsto Dieva priesteri ?

text: Then said Paul , I wist not , brethren , that he was the high priest : for it is written , Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people .
text2: Bet Pāvils sacīja : Es nezināju , ka viņš ir augstais priesteris , jo ir rakstīts : Savas tautas priekšnieku tev nebūs zaimot .

text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees , and the other Pharisees , he cried out in the council , Men and brethren , I am a Pharisee , the son of a Pharisee : of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question .
text2: Bet Pāvils , zinādams , ka viena daļa ir saduceji un otra - farizeji , sauca augstajā tiesā : Vīri , brāļi ! Es esmu farizejs un farizeju dēls ; mani tiesā cerības dēļ un mirušo augšāmcelšanās dēļ .

text: And when he had so said , there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees : and the multitude was divided .
text2: Kad viņš to pateica , izcēlās nesaskaņas farizeju un saduceju starpā , un pūlis sašķēlas .

text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit : but the Pharisees confess both .
text2: Jo saduceji saka , ka nav ne augšāmcelšanās , ne eņģeļu , ne gara , bet farizeji visu to atzīst .

text: And there arose a great cry : and the scribes that were of the Pharisees ' part arose , and strove , saying , We find no evil in this man : but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him , let us not fight against God .
text2: Tad izcēlās liela kliegšana . Daži no farizejiem cēlās un strīdējās , sacīdami : Mēs nekā ļauna pie šī cilvēka neatrodam . Kas tad , ja gars vai eņģelis viņam runājis ?

text: And when there arose a great dissension , the chief captain , fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them , commanded the soldiers to go down , and to take him by force from among them , and to bring him into the castle .
text2: Kad strīds kļuva lielāks , priekšnieks , bīdamies , ka tie Pāvilu nesaplosa , pavēlēja kareivjiem iet un izraut viņu no to vidus , un ievest kareivju mītnē .

text: And the night following the Lord stood by him , and said , Be of good cheer , Paul : for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem , so must thou bear witness also at Rome .
text2: Nākošajā naktī Kungs viņam piestājās un sacīja : Esi pastāvīgs ! Kā tu par mani liecināji Jeruzalemē , tā tev jāliecina arī Romā .

text: And when it was day , certain of the Jews banded together , and bound themselves under a curse , saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul .
text2: Kad diena bija uzaususi , daži no jūdiem sapulcējās un deva solījumu , sacīdami : Mēs neēdīsim un nedzersim , kamēr Pāvilu nenonāvēsim .

text: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy .
text2: Bet to , kas tā sazvērējušies , bija vairāk nekā kā četrdesmit vīru .

text: And they came to the chief priests and elders , and said , We have bound ourselves under a great curse , that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul .
text2: Tie aizgāja pie augstajiem priesteriem un vecākajiem un sacīja : Mēs devām solījumu nekā nebaudīt , iekams Pāvilu nenonāvēsim .

text: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow , as though ye would inquire something more perfectly concerning him : and we , or ever he come near , are ready to kill him .
text2: Tagad jūs kopā ar augsto tiesu ziņojiet priekšniekam , lai viņš to atved pie jums it kā viņa rūpīgākai nopratināšanai , bet mēs būsim gatavi viņu nonāvēt , pirms viņš šeit tuvosies .

text: And when Paul ' s sister ' s son heard of their lying in wait , he went and entered into the castle , and told Paul .
text2: Pāvila māsas dēls , dzirdēdams par šo viltību , nāca , iegāja kareivju mītnē un paziņoja Pāvilam .

text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him , and said , Bring this young man unto the chief captain : for he hath a certain thing to tell him .
text2: Tad Pāvils , pieaicinājis vienu no virsniekiem pie sevis , sacīja : Aizved šo jaunekli pie priekšnieka , jo viņam ir kaut kas tam ziņojams .

text: So he took him , and brought him to the chief captain , and said , Paul the prisoner called me unto him , and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee , who hath something to say unto thee .
text2: Tad tas paņēma to līdz , un aizvedis pie priekšnieka , sacīja : Apcietinātais Pāvils lūdza man atvest šo jaunekli pie tevis , jo viņam esot kaut kas tev sakāms .

text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand , and went with him aside privately , and asked him , What is that thou hast to tell me ?
text2: Priekšnieks , paņēmis viņu pie rokas , aizgāja ar to savrup un jautāja viņam : Kas tas ir , ko tu gribi man ziņot ?

text: And he said , The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council , as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly .
text2: Tad viņš sacīja : Jūdi norunājuši lūgt tevi , lai tu rītdien vestu Pāvilu uz augsto tiesu it kā viņa rūpīgākai nopratināšanai ;

text: But do not thou yield unto them : for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men , which have bound themselves with an oath , that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him : and now are they ready , looking for a promise from thee .
text2: Bet tu netici tiem , jo no tiem vairāk nekā četrdesmit vīru uzglūn viņam . Tie solījušies neēst un nedzert , iekams viņu nenonāvēs , un tagad tie sagatavoti un gaida tavu piekrišanu .

text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart , and charged him , See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me .
text2: Tad priekšnieks atlaida jaunekli , pavēlēdams nevienam nesacīt , ka to viņam paziņojis .

text: And he called unto him two centurions , saying , Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea , and horsemen threescore and ten , and spearmen two hundred , at the third hour of the night ;
text2: Un viņš , pasaucis divus virsniekus , sacīja tiem : Sagatavojiet trešajai nakts stundai divi simti kareivju , kas lietu uz Cēzareju , un septiņdesmit jātniekus , un divi simti šķēpnešus .

text: And provide them beasts , that they may set Paul on , and bring him safe unto Felix the governor .
text2: Un sakārtojiet jājamos lopus , lai Pāvilu uzsēdinātu un novestu viņu veselu pie zemes pārvaldnieka Fēliksa .

text: And he wrote a letter after this manner :
text2: ( Jo viņš baidījās , ka jūdi kādreiz nepaņem to ar varu un nenonāvē , un vēlāk viņam pašam nebūtu jācieš zaimi , it kā viņš gribējis naudu pieņemt . )

text: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting .
text2: Viņš rakstīja šāda satura vēstuli : Klaudijs Lizijs sveicina viscienīgāko zemes pārvaldnieku Fēliksu .

text: This man was taken of the Jews , and should have been killed of them : then came I with an army , and rescued him , having understood that he was a Roman .
text2: Šo vīru jūdi bija saņēmuši un taisījās nogalināt , bet es , uzzinājis , ka viņš ir romietis , piesteidzos ar karaspēku un izglābu to ;

text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him , I brought him forth into their council :
text2: Bet gribēdams zināt , kādu vainu tie viņam pārmet , es to novedu viņu augstajā tiesā .

text: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Es atradu , ka tie viņu apsūdz bauslības jautājumos , bet ne noziegumā , kas pelnītu nāvi vai važas .

text: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man , I sent straightway to thee , and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him . Farewell .
text2: Kad man tika ziņots par slazdiem , ko tie viņam sagatavojuši , es nosūtīju viņu pie tevis , paziņodams arī sūdzētājiem , lai tie izsakās tavā priekšā . Paliec vesels !

text: Then the soldiers , as it was commanded them , took Paul , and brought him by night to Antipatris .
text2: Tad kareivji , izpildot pavēli , ņēma Pāvilu un naktī aizveda uz Antipatrīdu .

text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the castle :
text2: Nākošajā dienā , atlaiduši jātniekus iet ar viņu tālāk , paši atgriezās karaspēka mītnē .

text: Who , when they came to Caesarea , and delivered the epistle to the governor , presented Paul also before him .
text2: Nonākuši Cēzarejā un atdevuši vēstuli zemes pārvaldniekam , tie veda arī Pāvilu viņa priekšā .

text: And when the governor had read the letter , he asked of what province he was . And when he understood that he was of Cilicia ;
text2: To izlasījis , tas vaicāja , no kāda apgabala viņš , un , uzzinājis , ka no Kilikijas ,

text: I will hear thee , said he , when thine accusers are also come . And he commanded him to be kept in Herod ' s judgment hall .
text2: Viņš teica : Es tevi uzklausīšu , kad atnāks tavi apsūdzētāji ; un viņš pavēlēja to apsargāt Heroda tiesas pilī .

text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders , and with a certain orator named Tertullus , who informed the governor against Paul .
text2: Pēc piecām dienām augstais priesteris Ananija kopā ar dažiem vecākajiem un kādu runātāju Tertullu atnāca pie zemes pārvaldnieka , lai vērstos pret Pāvilu .

text: And when he was called forth , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness , and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence ,
text2: Kad Pāvils bija atsaukts , Tertulls sāka to apsūdzēt , sacīdams : Pateicoties tev un tavai aizgādībai , mēs dzīvojam pilnīgā mierā un daudz kas ticis labots

text: We accept it always , and in all places , most noble Felix , with all thankfulness .
text2: Visteicamākais Fēliks ! Un mēs vienmēr un visur to visā pateicībā atzīstam .

text: Notwithstanding , that I be not further tedious unto thee , I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words .
text2: Bet lai pārāk ilgi tevi neaizkavētu , es lūdzu savā laipnībā īsumā uzklausīt mūs .

text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow , and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes :
text2: Mēs atradām , ka šis cilvēks ir mēris un nemiera cēlājs starp visiem jūdiem visā pasaulē un Nācarieša sektas vadītājs ,

text: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple : whom we took , and would have judged according to our law .
text2: Kas mēģināja apgānīt arī svētnīcu . Mēs viņu notvērām un gribējām tiesāt pēc mūsu likuma .

text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us , and with great violence took him away out of our hands ,
text2: Bet priekšnieks Lizijs atnāca ar lielu spēku un , izrāvis to no mūsu rokām ,

text: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee : by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things , whereof we accuse him .
text2: Pavēlēja , lai apsūdzētāji nāk pie tevis . Tu pats , viņu nopratinājis , varēsi uzzināt visu to , par ko mēs viņu apsūdzam .

text: And the Jews also assented , saying that these things were so .
text2: Arī jūdi tam piekrita un sacīja , ka tas tā ir .

text: Then Paul , after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak , answered , Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation , I do the more cheerfully answer for myself :
text2: Tad Pāvils , kad zemes pārvaldnieks māja viņam runāt , atbildēja : Zinādams , ka tu daudz gadus esi šīs tautas tiesnesis , es drošu prātu aizstāvu sevi .

text: Because that thou mayest understand , that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship .
text2: Tu vari pārliecināties , ka nav vairāk kā divpadsmit dienu , kopš es aizgāju uz Jeruzalemi pielūgt Dievu ;

text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man , neither raising up the people , neither in the synagogues , nor in the city :
text2: Un viņi nav atraduši mani svētnīcā ar kādu strīdamies , ne ļaudis kūdām uz sacelšanos ne sinagogās ,

text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me .
text2: Ne pilsētā ; tie nevar tev pierādīt arī to , par ko tie mani apsūdz .

text: But this I confess unto thee , that after the way which they call heresy , so worship I the God of my fathers , believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets :
text2: Bet atzīstos tanī , ka es pēc tās mācības , ko viņi sauc par maldu mācību , kalpoju savam Tēvam un Dievam , ticēdams visam , kas uzrakstīts bauslībā un praviešos .

text: And have hope toward God , which they themselves also allow , that there shall be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and unjust .
text2: Un man ir cerība uz Dievu un uz taisnīgo un netaisnīgo augšāmcelšanos , kādu arī viņi paši gaida .

text: And herein do I exercise myself , to have always a conscience void of offence toward God , and toward men .
text2: Tāpēc es arī cenšos vienmēr paturēt tīru sirdsapziņu Dieva un cilvēku priekšā .

text: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings .
text2: Bet pēc vairākiem gadiem es atnācu , lai nodotu dāvanas savai tautai un upurētu , un dotu solījumus .

text: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple , neither with multitude , nor with tumult .
text2: Un viņi mani atrada svētnīcā šķīstītu , ne pūlī un ne drūzmā .

text: Who ought to have been here before thee , and object , if they had ought against me .
text2: Tāpēc dažiem Āzijas jūdiem vajadzēja būt šeit tavā priekšā un apsūdzēt , ja tiem kas būtu pret mani .

text: Or else let these same here say , if they have found any evil doing in me , while I stood before the council ,
text2: Vai šie paši lai saka , kādu netaisnību tie manī atklājuši , kad es stāvēju augstās tiesas priekšā ,

text: Except it be for this one voice , that I cried standing among them , Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day .
text2: Vai vienīgi saucienu dēļ , ko es saucu , viņu vidū stāvēdams : jūs šodien mani tiesājat mirušo augšāmcelšanās dēļ .

text: And when Felix heard these things , having more perfect knowledge of that way , he deferred them , and said , When Lysias the chief captain shall come down , I will know the uttermost of your matter .
text2: Tad Fēlikss , labi šo mācību pazīdams , atlika šo lietu , sacīdams : Es jūs uzklausīšu , kad atnāks priekšnieks Lizijs .

text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul , and to let him have liberty , and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him .
text2: Un viņš pavēlēja virsniekam to apsargāt , dot viņam mieru un neliegt nevienam no savējiem sniegt viņam pakalpojumus .

text: And after certain days , when Felix came with his wife Drusilla , which was a Jewess , he sent for Paul , and heard him concerning the faith in Christ .
text2: Pēc dažām dienām atnāca Fēlikss kopā ar Druzillu , savu sievu , kas bija jūdiete , un , ataicinājis Pāvilu , klausījās viņu par ticību uz Jēzu Kristu .

text: And as he reasoned of righteousness , temperance , and judgment to come Felix trembled , and answered , Go thy way for this time ; when I have a convenient season , I will call for thee .
text2: Kad viņš runāja par taisnību un par šķīstību , un nākamo tiesu , tad Fēlikss pārbijās un atbildēja : Tagad ej ! Attiecīgā brīdī es tevi atkal aicināšu .

text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul , that he might loose him : wherefore he sent for him the oftener , and communed with him .
text2: Bet viņš turklāt arī cerēja , ka Pāvils viņam dos naudu , tāpēc tas bieži aicināja viņu un runāja ar to .

text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix ' room : and Felix , willing to shew the Jews a pleasure , left Paul bound .
text2: Kad divi gadi bija pagājuši , Porcijs Fēsts kļuva Fēliksa pēctecis . Fēlikss , gribēdams jūdiem parādīt labvēlību , atstāja Pāvilu cietumā .

text: Now when Festus was come into the province , after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
text2: Nonācis šinī apgabalā , Fēsts pēc trim dienām devās no Cēzarejas uz Jeruzalemi .

text: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul , and besought him ,
text2: Augstie priesteri un ievērojamākie jūdi apsūdzēja viņam Pāvilu un griezās pie viņa ,

text: And desired favour against him , that he would send for him to Jerusalem , laying wait in the way to kill him .
text2: Izlūgdamies labvēlību pret to , lai viņš pavēlētu vest to uz Jeruzalemi , jo tiem bija slepens nodoms ceļā viņu nonāvēt .

text: But Festus answered , that Paul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he himself would depart shortly thither .
text2: Tad Fēsts atbildēja , ka Pāvils tiek apsargāts Cēzarejā , bet viņš pats drīzumā došoties ceļā .

text: Let them therefore , said he , which among you are able , go down with me , and accuse this man , if there be any wickedness in him .
text2: Viņš sacīja : Kas no jums var , lai nāk līdz un , ja šis vīrs noziedzies , lai apsūdz viņu !

text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days , he went down unto Caesarea ; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought .
text2: Palicis ar tiem ne vairāk kā astoņas vai desmit dienas , viņš atgriezās Cēzarejā un otrā dienā , noturēdams tiesas sēdi , lika atvest Pāvilu .

text: And when he was come , the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about , and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul , which they could not prove .
text2: Kad viņš bija atvests , no Jeruzalemes atnākušie jūdi nostājās ap viņu , celdami daudz un smagas apsūdzības , kuras tie nevarēja pierādīt .

text: While he answered for himself , Neither against the law of the Jews , neither against the temple , nor yet against Caesar , have I offended any thing at all .
text2: Pāvils aizstāvējās : Es neesmu grēkojis ne pret jūdu likumu , ne pret svētnīcu , ne pret ķeizaru .

text: But Festus , willing to do the Jews a pleasure , answered Paul , and said , Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these things before me ?
text2: Tad Fēsts , gribēdams parādīt jūdiem labvēlību , atbildēja Pāvilam , sacīdams : Vai tu gribi iet uz Jeruzalemi , lai tur tevi tiesātu manā priekšā par šīm lietām ?

text: Then said Paul , I stand at Caesar ' s judgment seat , where I ought to be judged : to the Jews have I done no wrong , as thou very well knowest .
text2: Bet Pāvils sacīja : Es stāvu ķeizara tiesas priekšā , tur pienākas mani tiesāt . Jūdiem neesmu ļaunu darījis , kā tu to vēl labāk zini .

text: For if I be an offender , or have committed any thing worthy of death , I refuse not to die : but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me , no man may deliver me unto them . I appeal unto Caesar .
text2: Ja es esmu darījis netaisnību vai kaut ko tādu , par ko būtu nāvi pelnījis , tad es neatsakos mirt . Bet ja nekā tāda nav , par ko viņi mani apsūdz , neviens nevar mani tiem nodot . Es pārsūdzu ķeizaram .

text: Then Festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , Hast thou appealed unto Caesar ? unto Caesar shalt thou go .
text2: Tad Fēsts , apspriedies ar augsto tiesu , atbildēja : Tu parsūdzēji ķeizaram ? Pie ķeizara tu iesi !

text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus .
text2: Kad dažas dienas bija pagājušas , ķēniņš Agripa un Berenīke ieradās Cēzarejā apsveikt Fēstu .

text: And when they had been there many days , Festus declared Paul ' s cause unto the king , saying , There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix :
text2: Kad tie vairākas dienas tur uzturējās , Fēsts izstāstīja ķēniņam par Pāvilu , sacīdams : Fēlikss atstājis cietumā kādu vīru .

text: About whom , when I was at Jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me , desiring to have judgment against him .
text2: To augstie priesteri un jūdu vecākie apsūdzēja man , kad biju Jeruzalemē , lūgdami , lai viņu notiesā .

text: To whom I answered , It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die , before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face , and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him .
text2: Es tiem atbildēju , ka romiešiem nav paraduma notiesāt kādu cilvēku , pirms apsūdzētajam nav stājušies pretim sūdzētāji un tas nav dabūjis iespēju aizstāvēties un pierādīt savu nevainību .

text: Therefore , when they were come hither , without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat , and commanded the man to be brought forth .
text2: Kad tie bija sanākuši , es bez vilcināšanās nākošajā dienā , tiesas krēslā sēdēdams , pavēlēju šo vīru atvest .

text: Against whom when the accusers stood up , they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed :
text2: Kad uzstājās apsūdzētāji , tie neuzrādīja nevienu vainu , kurā es varētu saskatīt kādu ļaunumu .

text: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition , and of one Jesus , which was dead , whom Paul affirmed to be alive .
text2: Bet tie cēla apsūdzību pret to par viņu pašu reliģiju un par kādu Jēzu , kas miris , bet Pāvils apgalvo , ka Viņš dzīvo .

text: And because I doubted of such manner of questions , I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these matters .
text2: Šādus jautājumus nepārzinādams , es sacīju , vai viņš negrib iet uz Jeruzalemi , lai tie viņu tur tiesātu .

text: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus , I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar .
text2: Bet kad Pāvils pārsūdzēja , lai viņu atstāj ķeizara spriedumam , es pavēlēju viņu apsargāt , kamēr to sūtīšu pie ķeizara .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus , I would also hear the man myself . To morrow , said he , thou shalt hear him .
text2: Tad Agripa sacīja Fēstam : Es pats arī vēlētos dzirdēt šo cilvēku . Tas atbildēja : Rīt tu viņu dzirdēsi .

text: And on the morrow , when Agrippa was come , and Bernice , with great pomp , and was entered into the place of hearing , with the chief captains , and principal men of the city , at Festus ' commandment Paul was brought forth .
text2: Nākošajā dienā , kad lielā greznumā ieradās Agripa un Berenīke un kopā ar virsniekiem un pilsētas dižciltīgajiem vīriem iegāja tiesas telpās , Fēsts pavēlēja atvest Pāvilu .

text: And Festus said , King Agrippa , and all men which are here present with us , ye see this man , about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me , both at Jerusalem , and also here , crying that he ought not to live any longer .
text2: Un Fēsts sacīja : Ķēniņ Agripa un visi vīri , kas līdz ar mums šeit esat ! Jūs redzat to , kura dēļ Jeruzalemē man uzmācās viss jūdu vairums , lūgdami un kliegdami : Šis nedrīkst ilgāk dzīvot .

text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death , and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus , I have determined to send him .
text2: Bet es pārliecinājos , ka viņš nav nekā nodarījis , par ko būtu nāvi pelnījis . Kad viņš pats pārsūdzēja ķeizaram , es nolēmu viņu sūtīt turp .

text: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord . Wherefore I have brought him forth before you , and specially before thee , O king Agrippa , that , after examination had , I might have somewhat to write .
text2: Bet man nav nekā noteikta , ko par viņu kungam rakstīt . Tāpēc es viņu atvedu pie jums un sevišķi pie tevis , ķēniņ Agripa , lai pēc nopratināšanas man būtu ko rakstīt .

text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner , and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him .
text2: Jo , man šķiet , būtu neprātīgi sūtīt cietumnieku , neminot viņa vainas .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Thou art permitted to speak for thyself . Then Paul stretched forth the hand , and answered for himself :
text2: Agripa sacīja Pāvilam : Tev atļauts runāt par sevi . Tad Pāvils izstiepa roku un iesāka aizstāvēšanos .

text: I think myself happy , king Agrippa , because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews :
text2: Es jūtos laimīgs , ķēniņ Agripa , ka es šodien varu aizstāvēties tavā priekšā pret visu , par ko jūdi mani apsūdz .

text: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews : wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently .
text2: Jo vairāk tāpēc , ka tu zini visas jūdu paražas un strīdus jautājumus ; tāpēc es tevi lūdzu pacietīgi mani uzkausīt .

text: My manner of life from my youth , which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem , know all the Jews ;
text2: Manu dzīvi no pat jaunības , kāda tā bijusi no sākuma manas tautas vidū Jeruzalemē , zina visi jūdi .

text: Which knew me from the beginning , if they would testify , that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee .
text2: Viņi pazīst mani no sākuma ( ja tie gribētu liecināt ) , ka es esmu dzīvojis pēc mūsu reliģijas visstingrākā novirziena , būdams farizejs .

text: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers :
text2: Un tagad es stāvu tiesas priekšā par cerību uz apsolījumu , ko Dievs devis mūsu tēviem ;

text: Unto which promise our twelve tribes , instantly serving God day and night , hope to come . For which hope ' s sake , king Agrippa , I am accused of the Jews .
text2: To mūsu divpadsmit ciltis , dienām un naktīm kalpodamas , cer sasniegt . Šīs cerības dēļ , ķēniņ , jūdi mani apsūdz .

text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you , that God should raise the dead ?
text2: Kāpēc jums šķiet neticami , ka Dievs uzmodina mirušos ?

text: I verily thought with myself , that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Arī es domāju , ka man vajag Nācarieša Jēzus vārdam daudz pretoties .

text: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem : and many of the saints did I shut up in prison , having received authority from the chief priests ; and when they were put to death , I gave my voice against them .
text2: To es arī darīju Jeruzalemē . Saņēmis pilnvaras no augstajiem priesteriem , es daudzus no svētajiem ieslēdzu cietumos un viņu nonāvēšanai devu savu piekrišanu .

text: And I punished them oft in every synagogue , and compelled them to blaspheme ; and being exceedingly mad against them , I persecuted them even unto strange cities .
text2: Visās sinagogās , daudzkārt tos sodīdams , es piespiedu zaimot un , pārāk pret tiem trakodams , vajāju tos pat svešās pilsētās .

text: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests ,
text2: Ar augsto priesteru pilnvaru un atļauju iedams šinī nolūkā uz Damasku ,

text: At midday , O king , I saw in the way a light from heaven , above the brightness of the sun , shining round about me and them which journeyed with me .
text2: Ceļā dienas vidū , ķēniņ , es redzēju gaismu no debesīm , kas bija spožāka par sauli , apspīdam mani un tos , kas bija kopā ar mani .

text: And when we were all fallen to the earth , I heard a voice speaking unto me , and saying in the Hebrew tongue , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks .
text2: Kad mēs visi nokritām zemē , es dzrdēju balsi ebreju valodā man sakām : Saul , Saul , kāpēc tu mani vajā ? Grūti tev spert dzenulim pretim .

text: And I said , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said , I am Jesus whom thou persecutest .
text2: Tad es sacīju : Kungs , kas Tu esi ? Kungs teica : Es esmu Jēzus , ko tu vajā .

text: But rise , and stand upon thy feet : for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose , to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen , and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee ;
text2: Bet celies un nostājies uz savām kājām , jo es tāpēc tev parādījos , lai ieceltu tevi par kalpu un liecinieku tam , ko es tev atklāšu ,

text: Delivering thee from the people , and from the Gentiles , unto whom now I send thee ,
text2: Izraudzīdamies tevi no tautas un pagāniem , pie kuriem es tevi tagad sūtu

text: To open their eyes , and to turn them from darkness to light , and from the power of Satan unto God , that they may receive forgiveness of sins , and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me .
text2: Atvērt viņu acis , lai tie no tumsas atgrieztos gaismā un no sātana varas pie Dieva , lai tie ticībā uz mani saņemtu grēku piedošanu un mantojumu svēto pulkā .

text: Whereupon , O king Agrippa , I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision :
text2: Tāpēc , ķēniņ Agripa , es šai debesu parādībai nebiju nepaklausīgs ,

text: But shewed first unto them of Damascus , and at Jerusalem , and throughout all the coasts of Judaea , and then to the Gentiles , that they should repent and turn to God , and do works meet for repentance .
text2: Bet es sludināju vispirms tiem , kas Damaskā un Jeruzalemē , un visā jūdu zemē , kā arī pagāniem , lai nožēlo grēkus un atgriežas pie Dieva , un dara darbus , kas ir grēku nožēlas cienīgi .

text: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple , and went about to kill me .
text2: Šī iemesla dēļ , kad biju svētnīcā , jūdi mani sagrāba un mēģināja nonāvēt .

text: Having therefore obtained help of God , I continue unto this day , witnessing both to small and great , saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come :
text2: Bet Dieva palīdzības sargāts , es stāvu līdz šai dienai kā liecinieks maziem un lieliem , neko citu nesacīdams , kā vien to , ko pravieši un Mozus runājuši par to , kas notiks .

text: That Christ should suffer , and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead , and should shew light unto the people , and to the Gentiles .
text2: Ka Kristum jācieš , ka Viņš pirmais no miroņiem augšāmcelsies , lai sludinātu gaismu savai tautai un pagāniem .

text: And as he thus spake for himself , Festus said with a loud voice , Paul , thou art beside thyself ; much learning doth make thee mad .
text2: Kad viņš tā runāja un aizstāvējās , Fēsts sacīja skaļā balsī : Neprātīgais Pāvil , daudzās mācības noved tevi līdz ārprātam !

text: But he said , I am not mad , most noble Festus ; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness .
text2: Tad Pāvils sacīja : Viscienīgākais Fēst , es neesmu ārprātīgs , bet es runāju patiesus un pādomātus vārdus ,

text: For the king knoweth of these things , before whom also I speak freely : for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him ; for this thing was not done in a corner .
text2: Jo to visu zina arī ķēniņš , uz kuru es vaļsirdīgi runāju . Es domāju , ka nekas no tā viņam nav apslēpts , jo tas nav noticis kādā nebūt kaktā .

text: King Agrippa , believest thou the prophets ? I know that thou believest .
text2: Ķēniņ Agripa , vai tu tici pravoešiem ? Es zinu , ka tu tici .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian .
text2: Tad Agripa sacīja Pāvilam : Tu gandrīz mani pārliecini kļūt par kristīgo .

text: And Paul said , I would to God , that not only thou , but also all that hear me this day , were both almost , and altogether such as I am , except these bonds .
text2: Un Pāvils sacīja : Lai Dievs dod , ka ne tikai gandrīz , bet pilnīgi nevien tu , bet arī visi , kas dzird , šodien kļūtu tādi , kāds es esmu , tikai bez šīm važām .

text: And when he had thus spoken , the king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and they that sat with them :
text2: Tad piecēlās ķēniņš un zemes pārvaldnieks , un Berenīke , un tie , kas kopā ar viņiem sēdēja .

text: And when they were gone aside , they talked between themselves , saying , This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Aizgājuši tie sarunājās savā starpā , sacīdami : Šis cilvēks neko tādu nav darījis , ar ko būtu pelnījis nāvi vai važas .

text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus , This man might have been set at liberty , if he had not appealed unto Caesar .
text2: Bet Agripa sacīja Fēstam : Šo cilvēku varētu atbrīvot , ja viņš nebūtu pārsūdzējis ķeizaram .

text: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy , they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius , a centurion of Augustus ' band .
text2: Kad bija nolemts , ka Pāvilam jāpārceļas uz Itāliju , viņu kopā ar citiem cietumniekiem nodeva ķeizara karaspēka vienības simtniekam , vārdā Jūlijam .
